items.title: Editor
items.content:
Editor at American Journal Experts - AJE

Remote | Freelance

Location: United States

At American Journal Experts (AJE), we help researchers successfully communicate their work through trusted author-oriented solutions to overcome the barriers to the manuscript preparation process. We are actively recruiting independent contractors from a variety of fields to edit scholarly LaTeX manuscripts originally written by non-native English speakers so that language is not a barrier to research communication.

AJE’s independent contract editors work remotely from anywhere with a stable internet connection, can edit within their areas of academic expertise and are compensated based on manuscript length. If editing assignments are made available to the contractor pool, contract editors are under no obligation to accept assignments.

We’re currently seeking editors who are skilled in LaTeX and have academic expertise in one of the following fields:

  • Biological sciences, especially bioinformatics
  • Business, finance, or economics
  • Physical sciences

In addition to LaTeX assignments, contract LaTeX editors may also claim assignments in Microsoft Word, provided that the editing is completed in the native format.

To qualify as an independent contract editor, applicants must:

  • either be enrolled in a graduate program or possess a graduate degree;
  • have native English proficiency; and
  • have a documented current or former affiliation (in the form of a degree, current enrollment, postdoctoral training, employment, or faculty appointment) with one of the US schools or institutions from which we recruit editors.

Ideal applicants for this position are proficient in LaTeX and have had exposure to literature in one of the target fields. The candidates who have been most successful in the contract editor role are autonomous, have editing experience and/or strong technical writing skills, and seek to make a positive impact on their field of expertise.

Apply for job

items.content:
Competitive salary + bonus structure
40 Hours per week
Contract length: 3 Months or longer

Film Daily is looking for an online News editor for their busy, entertainment-focused newsroom. This person will oversee our growing editorial and video team, who are focused on creating unique, shareable content on the themes of film, TV, entertainment, and new media. The right person will oversee the blue-sky editorial strategy for the company, as well as managing day-to-day operations of the publication.

The Editor will work hand-in-hand with the company directors, senior managers, partners, and editorial team to assure the highest level of content is produced to our tight deadlines.

We work with amazing, storied clients and new emerging technologies & agencies.

Our work environment is relaxed, but we tell it like it is. We value proficiency and promote from within. Positions tend to be flexible, with mainly work-at-home opportunities.

Position requirements
Are you a film & TV obsessive?
Do you know your Kurosawa from your Kubrick? Your Lynch from your Leigh? Your Girls from your Broad City?
Are you a high achiever? Do you have a proven track record of delivering exceptional results (in your last role, at university, on your personal projects)?
Do you understand the way the film & TV industries works?
Do you know how to use web searches to learn new skills?
Are you a dedicated lifelong learner?
Are you looking for a new challenge?
Are you willing to do whatever it takes to achieve results?
Are you able to prioritize your workload?
Do you think change in Hollywood is long overdue?
What we can offer for the right candidate
Ongoing training
Access to stream endless films & TV
Invitations to red carpet events & exclusive film previews
Market rate salary & attractive bonus structure
Travel opportunities within the UK & USA
Responsibilities
Oversee editorial team-setting deadlines and host daily scrum meetings.
Review trending news and assign features to writers.
Manage production of daily newsletter, including liaising with sponsors & partners.
Make sure all features & newsletters go out on time.
Analyze all available data to create writer assignments.
Set measurable goals for teams.
Recruit new writers & video creators.
Ensure all content has been promoted via all available tools.
Create detailed editorial calendars based on all available data.
Plan editorial strategically considering the long view.
Grow Film Daily’s presence on social media platforms.
Conceptualise new & innovative ways to tell stories across our media platforms.
Fact-check, proofread, and edit copy where needed
Liaise with team to boost sales & revenue.
Monitor staff performance and give relevant feedback.
Work with online advertising platforms to monetise our content.
Work with our growth hacker on advertising arbitrage content production.
Work with our social media team to create viral content.
Manage a team of interns.
The ideal candidate must possess
Proven track record of editorial skills, with a portfolio and references to back it up
Deep understanding of online magazines
WordPress admin skills
Deep understanding of social media and its relation to online publishing
Encyclopedic knowledge of film & TV
Stoic, can-do attitude
Proofreading and copyediting skills
Clear understanding of journalistic ethics & legal principles
Experience in strategic planning and management
Great attention to detail
High motivation
Exceptional communication & interpersonal skills
Excellent team leadership skills with experience motivating teams and influencing key stakeholders
Past experience running a successful online magazine
Knowledge of photo- and video-editing software
Experience with real-time social reporting
Fluency in sourcing stock images & videos
Understanding of the importance of community
Love of the internet & technology
Understanding of the digital landscape, being ahead of new developments
3+ years management experience in a media company
Experience working with online advertising agencies & aggregators
Demonstrated ability to drive strategy and make smart business decisions
Great sense of humor
Patience
Ambition
Learn about a day in the life of a Film Daily staffer here.

items.content:
Photography Blog Content Editor

Company: iPhone Photography School
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Full-time

Description

Attention Content Writers & Editors:

“Stop Wasting Your Time & Energy Writing About Topics You Don’t Really Care About… Become The Editor Of These Leading Photography Websites Instead!”

  • If you’d love to combine your work with your passion for photography…
  • If you want to use your skills to help millions of photographers worldwide…
  • And if you’d love to work together with world-class photographers…

Then this opportunity could literally change your life! But only if  you keep reading.

Our photography websites – iPhonePhotographySchool.com and PhotographyPro.com– are visited by over a million readers each month, and we’re looking to grow them even further.

Publishing excellent photography tutorials for free is an essential part of our strategy, which is why we’re looking for a talented content editor who will work with world-class photographers to share their knowledge with the world – while also ensuring a consistent quality of writing.

This is a full-time position, and you can work from anywhere in the world.

Click Here To Become A Full-Time Content Editor For Our Photography Websites

7 Reasons To Become A Full-Time Content Editor For Our Photography Websites

1. COMBINE YOUR WORK WITH YOUR PASSION

Do you have to write about topics you don’t really care about? As a writer or editor you spend most of your day working. So why not focus this time on something you actually care about?

Join our company, and you’ll spend your days polishing tutorials written by the world’s leading photography experts, and occasionally writing your own posts about topics you know well.

2. GET A STABLE INCOME YOU CAN COUNT ON

If you’re a freelance writer or editor, you already know how challenging it can be to earn a good living from writing. While some months are great, others can be a real struggle financially…

Join our company, and you’ll get a competitive salary every single month, without ever having to look for new clients or side gigs again!

3. WORK WITH THE BEST PHOTOGRAPHERS IN THE WORLD

If you’d like to hone your craft as a photographer, then this is the perfect opportunity!

You’ll be collaborating with world-class photographers on a daily basis, and your job will be to bring their best techniques to the world in a simple and easy to understand way.

4. HELP MILLIONS OF PEOPLE IMPROVE THEIR PHOTOGRAPHY

Helping others is one of the most rewarding things you can do in life. While this is something that everyone should practice in their daily life, you can also do it while earning a living.

Join our company, and your work will directly benefit millions of people. You’ll not only inspire your readers to take beautiful photos, but also to preserve their most cherished memories!

5. LEARN FROM WORLD-CLASS ONLINE MARKETERS

With the overabundance of blogs and social media, more content is released today than ever before. But only a tiny proportion of that content will ever get any significant readership.

So what makes your content stand out from the crowd? Join our company, and you’ll learn the most up to date online marketing strategies that will help your work reach a global audience.

6. JOIN A COMPANY YOU ACTUALLY BELIEVE IN

As one of the world’s most successful photography training companies, we aim for excellence in everything we do, including the quality of our courses and customer support. We track customer satisfaction (NPS) for all our courses, and our scores are on par with companies like Apple.

Join our company, and you’ll never have to use your skills to promote poor quality products.

7. WORK FROM ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD

We understand that the best writers like to work on their own terms. So you can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our office in Latvia, or any paradise location!

If the initial collaboration turns out to be successful, our company will pay for a week-long trip to Latvia where you’ll meet the rest of our team and get acquainted with our company culture.

HERE’S WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU…

  • You’re a native English speaker with a passion for writing
  • You have worked or studied as a writer or editor before
  • You can explain technical concepts in very simple terms
  • You’re highly comfortable with technology and internet
  • You’re at least an intermediate-level photographer
  • You have an excellent attention to detail

Please only apply if you meet all these criteria. Other applications will not be considered.

Click Here To Become A Full-Time Content Editor For Our Photography Websites

JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
United States

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: DARREN HARDY, LLC; 10-50 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Digital Marketing
• Content Management
• Copywriting
• Direct Response

Imagine a world where people wake up every morning inspired to grow, be excellent and make an impact.
That’s what we do, and we need your help.

Darren Hardy (www.DarrenHardy.com), mentor to top CEOs and business leaders, NY Times bestselling author, keynote speaker and founding publisher of SUCCESS magazine, and his amazingly talented A-Team are looking to hire a superstar Direct Response Copywriter.

This is not your typical office job. Our passionately engaged A-Team works virtually but collaborates vigorously. The lifestyle design is flexible but the culture is fast-paced. We consider our work our “art” and strive for excellence in everything we do. This is what we believe.

Our mission is to help business leaders and high achievers make an IMPACT through live workshops, digital training systems and proprietary resources.

If inside you are saying “Hell Yeah!” please continue…

-You are the SUPERSTAR we desire if...
-You have an innate knack of transforming written content into magically persuasive and influential direct response copy.
-You are PUMPED by the opportunity to help us positively influence today's greatest influencers.
-You are a confident, resourceful and a highly motivated self-starter who can work independently and don’t require someone looking over your shoulder all day.
-You execute with speed and decisiveness.
-You are a BIG THINKER with a humble heart.
-You have a relentless commitment to continuous self-improvement.
-You are jazzed to be able to work virtually from home.
-You are excited to travel to our live events (2 to 4 per year in awesome locations) to meet the incredible achievers of our community, all expenses paid.
-You have a positive mindset. You see opportunity and value within a challenge. No debbie-downers allowed.
-You love to engage and collaborate with a team (check out this badass team).
-You have high standards for your work. Details matter to you. Results matter to you. Excellence matters to you.
-You are invigorated by the constant change of a high-growth organization with bold and audacious goals.

What you will do:
-Transform already written content (by Darren) into gotta-have-it persuasive headlines and direct response copy specific to the medium being used (paid ads, email, landing pages, articles, video scripts and more).
-What company comes to mind when you think of the best, most persuasive, most influential content marketing in the world? FANTASTIC! Let’s do it better.

BIG NOTE: This position is NOT about taking a blank page and writing fresh copy… This position is about taking existing copy and making it MORE persuasive, MORE attractive, MORE gotta-have-it across multiple mediums and channels.


The experience you need:
-You must be AMAZING at direct response headlines and copywriting.
-You must understand the different mediums and channels and how to effectively write persuasive copy for each (email, FB ads, Google ads, articles, landing pages, etc.)

Compensation: BETTER than competitive.
We pay to have the BEST.

NOTE: SUPERSTARS ONLY.
Please do not apply for this position unless you can prove through documentation that you are an well versed direct response copywriter. This is a highly coveted position and we will only settle for an A-player. We don’t tolerate any of this.

If you are PUMPED about this position, then go here to submit your information and follow the steps to apply (<5min): https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/ZCV5B7B

Don’t fear - we take every candidate that follows our instructions VERY seriously and will give you our prompt and undivided attention.

items.title: Community Administrator
items.content:
Community Administrator

Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type: Community Full-time

Job Description

Our Community Team Is Expanding!

Due to rapid growth, we are looking for enthusiastic individuals looking to join a leading VC, helping high quality portfolio projects that we are currently assisting, with community support via Telegram.

Community Administrator

  • The crypto space tends to move fast. Its investor audience expects questions to be answered at similar speed by Community Administrators. Investors perform due diligence profoundly and engage with Community Administrators to have critical questions answered.
  • Public image of a project stands or falls by the responsiveness of its Community Administrators.
  • The longevity and success of a project is ensured by the strength of its community support.

The Community Administrator

  • Is the face of Ledger Capital and its upcoming projects. He/She embodies its vision and professionalism, goes the extra for community members and investors, keeps a positive attitude at all times, and keeps disputes in public channels to a minimum (ideally settled via a private channel).
  • Shall implement the Ledger Capital’s Online Community Moderation Strategy.
  • Shall Monitor and moderate user-generated content to ensure that the online community is maintained as a safe and user-friendly environment.
  • Shall ensure a safe and legal community environment, promotion excellent customer service and help to cultivate a strong community around the project.
  • Shall coordinate with the internal Community Management Team.
  • Shall moderate communities located in social networking sites including Telegram, Twitter, Reddit, and other similar social media outlets, adapting methodology where appropriate. He/She will also disincentive the organizing of unofficial community channels.
  • Shall regularly feedback insights gained from community moderation into the Community Management Team.
  • Shall be flexible on working times when needed (especially during critical phases of a project).
  • Shall be prepared to work weekends.

Please note: If accepted you will be added to our roster and put onto projects when Ledger Capital assists with these. You will be only be paid during the times you’re actively working on projects.

Please make sure to include your Telegram @ in the application

Salary range

Competitive

items.title: Finance Editor
items.content:
Finance Editor at SmartBrief

Remote

Tracking Code: 392-897

Job Description
SmartBrief seeks full-time finance editor — midnight to 8 a.m. EST weekdays

Can you condense the day’s most important news into a roundup of two-sentence summaries?

Can you work with association and corporate clients to deliver quality newsletters that keep their industries informed?

Can you meet multiple daily deadlines?

Then you’re the person for us!

SmartBrief is seeking a full-time finance editor for daily email newsletters covering global financial news. Candidates would need to be available to work between midnight and 8 a.m. EST Monday through Friday. This is a TELECOMMUTING position.

What we’re looking for
Someone who thrives in a fast-paced, deadline-intensive, newsroom-style work environment. The ideal candidate has worked as a finance writer or editor for a newspaper, trade journal or industry publication with multiple daily deadlines. Candidates with experience in corporate communications at a financial services firm will also be considered. Knowledge of industry trends and global financial regulatory reform initiatives would be a HUGE plus. Our briefs summarize the top stories of the day for dozens of industry associations, and our editors work with freelancers to shape that content.

Applicants will be asked to complete timed writing and editing tests.

Job Duties:

  • Identify news stories for inclusion in SmartBrief’s finance and business newsletters.
  • Edit news summaries for grammar, style and tone for a particular audience.
  • Use online publishing tools to create email newsletters and other content.
  • Manage relationships with associations, corporations and other business clients as well as freelance writers and other content providers.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Proven writing and editing skills. Alternative: Three to five years of experience in a communications or research role with a news organization, consulting firm, trade association or other relevant group.
  • Ability to write and edit quickly and accurately on deadline.
  • Sophisticated understanding of how to find news and information on the Web.
  • Facility for using online publishing tools.
  • Knowledge of Associated Press style.
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills.
  • Proven record of sharing responsibilities and managing multiple projects/deadlines simultaneously.

About SmartBrief
Founded in 1999, SmartBrief is the leader in customized e-mail news services and reaches top-flight executives in a variety of markets, including advertising, retail, hospitality, telecom, health care and consumer packaged goods. We’re expanding rapidly and looking for exceptional, motivated individuals to join our team. At SmartBrief, employees enjoy an entrepreneurial work environment with accelerated advancement opportunities. SmartBrief is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Job Location: Telecommute, United States
Position Type: Full-Time/Regular

items.title: Content Writer
items.content:
Content Writer

Company: Must Amplify
Location: Brisbane

Job Type: Contract

Description

Our mission at Amplify is helping business owners and entrepreneurs find their voices, and we are looking for like minded people that want to align with that mission.

 

Business owners want their voices to be heard by the right people, they want their customers to feel what they feel, they want them to understand what they are trying to say. But so many business owners and entrepreneurs can’t find the right words.

 

At Amplify, we want to help our clients find those words. We even want to help them find the words for the conversations they don’t even know they need to have!

 

Are you someone that wants to help us on this mission?

 

We are looking for a couple of new people to join our team for regular content creation work.

 

This includes:

 

  •         Creating new blog and article posts of 350-500 words each and some longer form
  •         Creating social media copy
  •         Creating lead gen documents
  •         Editing existing content
  •         Creating web page content
  •         Copy for email nurture campaigns
  •         Interviewing our clients for content extraction

 

If this interests you, please fill out ‘The Become an Amplifyer’ form and include examples of sites that you have managed content for.

 

Amplify is a team of passionate and dedicated people located in 9 time zones and we are very connected with each other.

 

Communication is key, if this isn't your strength, then this role isn't for you. We prefer people in the team who have had experience working in a virtual team.

Applications without ‘The Become an Amplifyer’ form will NOT be considered.

iPhone Photography Writers Needed

Company: iPhone Photography School
Location: Anywhere

Description

Attention Expert iPhone Photographers:

“Get Paid To Help Millions Of People Improve Their iPhone Photography!”

  • If you want to get paid to combine your passion for photography and writing...
  • If you want to get high-profile exposure as a photographer and a writer...
  • And if you want to help millions of people improve their photography...

Then this page could literally change your life…

But only if you keep reading.

iPhonePhotographySchool.com is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. This website is visited by 1,121,104 readers each month, and we’re looking to grow it even further.

Publishing excellent photography tutorials for free is an essential part of our strategy. This is why we’re looking for expert iPhone photographers who want to share their knowledge with the world.

This is a long-term freelance position, and you can work from anywhere in the world.

5 Reasons To Become A Photography Writer For iPhone Photography School

1. Combine Your Passion For Photography And Writing

You love photography. You love writing. It's not always easy to find a way to combine your two passions, but it doesn't have to be the case.

Great photography and excellent writing is exactly what we're looking for.

Join us, and spend time doing what you truly love - writing about photography.

2. Get High-Profile Exposure As A Photographer

You already know this: to get recognition as a photographer, talent alone is not enough anymore. People have to have a way to discover you.

With 1,121,104 monthly readers, we're among the most established photography websites in the world. So when you'll get published on our site, unexpected opportunities will start flowing your way.

Our authors have gone on to become full-time photography teachers and participate in once in a lifetime photography projects - all thanks to getting discovered on our site.

3. Help Millions Of People Improve Their Photography

Helping others is one of the most rewarding things you can do in life. While this is something that everyone should practice in their daily life, you can also do it while earning a living.

Think about everything you've discovered as a photographer, and you'll realise how much you have to give back to others.

Write for us, and your work will directly benefit millions of people. You’ll not only inspire your readers to take beautiful photos, but also to preserve their most cherished memories!

4. Fast-Track Your Growth As A Writer

As a passionate writer, you'd love to get even better at your craft.

We get how important growth is for our writers. That's why your every article will receive a personalized video feedback from one of our world-class editors. They'll share every tip and trick they have to help you get better.

Write for us, and you'll improve your writing faster than ever before.

5. Get Industry-Leading Compensation

We value your work and unique knowledge as an expert iPhone photographer and writer, so we want to compensate your work fairly.

You'll receive ¢10 for every word and $2 for every image that goes in the final article. The more useful quality content you provide, the more you get paid.

Not only that, this is an industry-leading payment scheme. Think of it this way - you'll typically get to pocket between $200 and $400 for doing a job you love anyway.

Here’s What We Expect From You…

  • You’re an excellent photographer with a vast iPhone photography portfolio
  • You can explain complex technical and photography concepts in simple terms
  • You’re a native English speaker with a passion for writing
  • You can produce polished articles that don't need much editing
  • You have an excellent attention to detail
Please only apply if you meet all these criteria. Other applications will not be considered.

Click Here To Apply

If you delay submitting your application, someone else will be hired before you.

items.content:
Content Producer, English/Mandarin

Various
Near Carpinteria, California
Company: LinkedIn
Full Time

Overview

The LinkedIn Learning Content Team is looking for a Content Producer fluent in English and Mandarin.  Our team is driven by a passion for learning and creating best-in-class instructional tools. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the production of online courses in Mandarin.  This position is temporary (contract) and may be located remotely but with frequent travel to Carpinteria, CA.

About LinkedIn

LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.

Responsibilities:
  • Create, manage, and track schedules and processes related to course production
  • Manage course through end to end production/post-production processes
  • Review and correct written Simplified Chinese and spoken Mandarin text for courses.
  • Point of contact for vendors, internal and external stakeholders
  • Manage multiple projects in various stages of the product development cycle simultaneously
  • Manage and meet course release dates.
  • Work with other members of the Content team to bring courses live to the site
  • Coordinate with team members to develop supporting course materials and graphical elements.
  • Manage the logistics and scheduling of media recording.
  • Identify and acquire authors (Subject Matter Experts) to record Mandarin courses
  • Collaborate with authors (Subject Matter Experts) to develop courses in Mandarin that meet instructional requirements
  • Coach the author’s instruction and performance during recording.
  • Work to resolve quality production issues discovered after recording is complete.
  • Ability to travel to Carpinteria, CA on a regular basis to record the courses
  • Ability to work outside the regular business hours as this position may need to work with individuals in very different time zones.
  • Perform other duties as may be assigned.

    • Basic qualifications:
    • A minimum of 2 years of experience in managing projects
    • A minimum 2 years developing and delivering educational content OR managing the full cycle of the product development process OR translating content to/from Mandarin
    • Native language in Mandarin and fluency in both written and verbal English.

      • Preferred qualifications:
      • Experience managing multiple deadlines, organize and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment with little supervision
      • Experience applying instructional design principles, learning theory, and educational technologies in the design and development of online learning experiences
      • Excellent communication, editing, interpersonal, and organizational skills
      • Previous experience working with instructors, SMEs, or faculty preferred
      • Prior teaching experience preferred
      • Proven experience in developing effective online instructional content which incorporates video and audio media
      • Ability to work in a very fast-paced environment that changes constantly
      • High level of flexibility and ability to work with a degree of uncertainty and changes
      • Excellent software skills and experience with Mac and Windows environments and Google Apps
      • BA/BS degree

        • To apply for this job please visit the following URL: http://jobs.jobvite.com/linkedin/job/oIO77fwu →

items.title: Content Writer
items.content:
Content Writer

Location: Remote Boston US
Role and job type: ️ Content Full-time

Job Description

Job Summary
Eximchain is looking for a talented Content Writer to be part of our growing team. The successful candidate will be responsible for creating compelling blog posts, social media content, web copy and documentation that will lead to appealing to our target audience and boosting brand awareness. The responsibility includes expanding our digital footprint and driving more value through online content. The ideal candidate should be able to present a proven track record of producing pieces that increase engagement and drive targeted quality leads. This position requires a high level of creativity and the ability to use data-driven insights to write optimised materials. A candidate experienced in B2B content writing or the supply chain industry is preferred. If you are familiar with producing online content and have an eye for detail, we’d like to meet you. This position is open for remote-working.

Responsibilities

  • Research industry-related topics (combining online sources, interviews and studies)
  • Design the content strategy and curate the compelling story that applies the fast-changing industry trend in a timely manner
  • Write clear marketing copy to promote our technology/products
  • Regularly produce various content types, including email, social media posts, blogs and white papers
  • Edit content created by other members of the team
  • Schedule content publishing on time using content management tools
  • Prepare well-structured drafts using Google drive or content management tools
  • Use SEO best practices to generate traffic to our site
  • Actively manage and promote our blog, and pitch articles to relevant third-party platforms
  • Analyze content marketing metrics and makes changes as needed
  • Coordinate with marketing, product, business and tech teams to illustrate articles and to create innovative content ideas
  • Monitor the key industry issues and Eximchain related mentions online

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Marketing or related field
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in the relevant field
  • Knowledge of digital marketing tactics, including SEO, email marketing and web analytics
  • Proven work experience as a Content Writer, Copywriter or similar role in English
  • Portfolio of published articles
  • Excellent writing skills, as well as the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively
  • Experience doing research using multiple sources
  • The ability to consistently meet tight deadlines
  • Hands-on experience with content management tools, i.e. Medium, Hootsuite, GetResponse
  • Weekly call with the relevant team members
  • At least three years of experience writing for a B2B audience
  • Experience in the supply chain industry is a plus
  • Experience in the blockchain/cryptocurrency industry is a plus
  • Remote-working experience is a plus

Salary range

Negotiable

items.content:
Part-time Content Editor

Company: Kayak Advisors
Location: Remote

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Job Title: Part-Time Content Editor

Location: Remote/Online

We are seeking a freelance remote editor to edit content for https://kayakadvisors.com, a leading website in the kayak and watersports industries. The website provides product reviews and important information to readers, and we’re seeking a new team member to proofread and improve the content our experienced writing team provides.

As a part-time content editor, you will be taking articles upon their completion by the writer and working to improve the copy and the content to make the website more attractive and more useful to readers. Kayak Advisors is growing, and if you’d like to be part of that growth, we’d love to talk to you about working with us.

Responsibilities:

  • Editing website content in accordance with the style and content guidelines of the website.
  • Tailoring content written for the site to meet the needs of the reader and stay within the vision of the website.
  • Keeping in contact with other team members.
  • Editing for different styles of writing and tailoring content to a targeted niche audience.
  • Working with writers to improve content and provide feedback on writing if necessary.
  • Establishing and maintaining content expectations, including content accuracy, cohesiveness, and sophistication.
  • Mastering the content guidelines and the content creation process.
  • Adjusting content in the event the website needs to adjust its message or update facts.

Requirements:

  • Native English speaker
  • Previous editing experience of at least one year.
  • A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution. Degrees in English or a related field preferred.
  • Must be available at least 5 hours a week, and there will likely be options in the future to expand this time
  • Familiarity with AP style.
  • Be able to respond to and edit articles within a 3-day time frame.
  • Independent problem-solving skills.
  • Time management skills, including the ability to work with and manage several articles at once.
  • Strong written communications skills, including being able to keep a strong line of communication open with managers and writers.
  • Strong familiarity with Google Docs and Google Sheets.

Additional Preferences

  • Previous experience editing and working with WordPress strongly desired.
  • Knowledge or experience with kayaking and other aquatic sporting preferred.
  • Previous experience implementing SEO best practices.

What We Provide

  • Compensation will be $15 per hour.
  • Training in any relevant new skills or programs used in the editing process.
  • The freedom to make your own hours and schedule.
  • Familiarity with multiple-draft writing processes and long-form content.

Please Do the Following When Submitting Your Application

  • Please write the word “kayak” at the top of your application and send to [email protected]
  • Answer the following:
  1. What is your previous experience editing content? Specifically, what experience do you have editing and proofreading website content?
  2. What is your previous experience with kayaking or water sports? Are you interested in learning more about the industry?
  3. What is your availability to work? While you should be able to expect a 5-10 hour workload to start with, if you are available more work could potentially become available as the website increases content creation.
  4. What makes you stand out as an excellent editor?
  5. Is there anything else you would like us to know about you?

 

  • If you have any references or examples of your work that you’d like to submit, please do so with your application and/or message.

 

Application Instructions

Send your application to [email protected]

items.title: Editor / Content Manager - Long Term
items.content:
Editor / Content Manager – Long Term

Company: ClickThere, LLC
Location: Remote

Job Type: Contract

Description

ClickThere, LLC is a performance marketing company led by founders who have acquired millions of customers and managed hundreds of millions of dollars in online spend. ClickThere is made up of an extremely nimble team bringing together world class talent to scale customer acquisition in highly competitive verticals for leading online companies.

We're looking for a longer term manager contractor - not a per word writer position.

As our Content Manager/Editor you will:

  • Recruit, train, and manage freelance writers on our multiple website properties to generate high quality, memorable, and useful content
  • Create and enforce a style guide for each website property and likewise ensure all content matches
  • Edit posts, find and utilize photos, and push the “publish” button
  • Research and create new topic ideas with a focus on increasing our SEO
  • Design and implement a content calendar for each of our properties
  • Work with our in house designer and team to create interactive infographics, video, and other highly linkable and shareable content
  • Work with our third party SEO link building firms to create highly linkable content with a focus on increasing our organic rankings
  • Stay on top of the latest content marketing trends to ensure our websites and content fit the needs of our audiences
  • Writing some content yourself is welcomed and encouraged!
  • Never utter the words, “That’s not my job.”

Helpful Skills & Experience

  • You must have experience in editing and writing content for websites with a high amount of SEO traffic
  • You must have experience in managing multiple freelancers
  • You must know how to research and write SEO keyword focused copy, headlines, descriptions, and alt text
  • You must be able to write kick-butt content yourself in the absence of freelancers
  • You should know basic HTML so that you can ensure all posts/content/copy looks and fits in to each website template
  • You must be okay taking input from various stakeholders and implementing feedback
  • You must be okay working on a variety of projects, daily
  • You must not be afraid to test new ideas, find winners, and pull back on losers
  • You must be okay with constant change - we move quickly and test often
  • Extremely strong written and oral communication skills come second nature - we’re remote after all
  • Do we sound picky? We know. It’s because we only want the best.

What We Value

A driven self starter with a history of success. Always striving to exceed targets - we’re a performance marketing company after all! Clear and constant communication, transparency, open-mindedness, empathy, and a desire to win are just a few of ClickThere’s cultural values. We are looking for a person who understands this culture and will thrive within a team of people passionate about self-improvement, honesty and kicking ass every single day “at the office.”

Where You’ll Work

As a fully distributed team, you’ll be free to work from wherever in the world you desire.

Warning!

We’re not going to lie. This will be a demanding job with an extreme attention to performance. You should be a self starter who is able to handle multiple priorities and demanding stakeholders. We’re not unreasonable - we’re going to have fun and we’ll be in the trenches with you too.

items.title: Medical Writer – CERs
items.content:
Medical Writer – CERs at Philips

Remote
  • Bothell
  • United States of America – Home Based
  • Full time
  • 276983

Medical Writer CERs

Job Description

We welcome you to join Philips as a Medical Writer CERs supporting our Ultrasound product line in our Bothell, WA – open to remote

In this role, you have the opportunity to

The Medical Writer CERs is responsible for the preparation of processes, templates, and documents that support the creation of Clinical Evaluation Reports (CERs) and other presentations, publications, and regulatory writing needs of the Philips Clinical Affairs department:

  • Collect, appraise and analyze clinical data pertaining to a medical device.
  • Write documentation, such as Clinical Evaluation Reports (CERs) supporting regulatory submission.
  • Collaborate with internal (project owners, regulatory, study managers, statisticians, business leaders, etc.) and external (clinical consultants, subject matter experts, regulatory agencies) stakeholders to ensure comprehensive analysis of clinical evidence.
  • Ensure appropriate interpretation and dissemination of all evidence generated, including writing Clinical Study Reports (CSRs), Clinical Evaluation Reports (CERs), and supporting the timely publication of study results.
  • Create procedures and workflows related to the Clinical Development department. Review, assess, and revise document preparation procedures and SOPs as to their efficiency, workflow, and implementation.

You are responsible for

  • Design, implement and train on clinical processes and procedures that ensure appropriate clinical evaluation is performed
  • Write study reports and assist with preparing submissions to applicable regulatory authorities.
  • Write Clinical Evaluation Reports summarizing available clinical evidence.

Competencies

  • Proactive and flexible attitude with strong work ethic.
  • Able to quickly assess and understand stakeholder needs.
  • Ability to set priorities, work independently without direct supervision as well as part of a team.
  • Conscientious and precise delivery of work, even when under time pressure.
  • Open and clear communicator.
  • Proven track record of delivering clinical results, on time, within budget and in compliance to SOPs and regulations.
  • Comprehensive understanding of clinical trial regulations across multiple regions and work precisely according to procedures, rules and regulations and able to keep oversight on processes.

You are a part of

This position offers the opportunity to impact lives through the development and testing of quality Philips products and solutions that help countless people all over the world. We have a fantastic work environment and culture that is respectful and rewarding, and offers opportunities to develop and grow both personally and professionally.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Scientific or medical education (preferably Masters or PhD degree preferred in Biomedical Science or Health related field, or MD).
  • Experience with research methodology (including clinical investigation design and biostatistics).
  • Experience with relevant medical and scientific literature databases.
  • Experience with medical writing (e.g. post-graduate experience in a relevant science or in medicine; training and experience in medical writing, systematic review and clinical data appraisal).
  • Strong writing skills to produce quality clinical documents.
  • A demonstrated working knowledge of GCP, ICH guidelines, FDA regulations and EU regulations.
  • >5 years of experience in a similar role in the Medical Device or Pharma industry.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English); multiple languages is a plus.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with various teams – clinical operations, engineering, cross-functional team members, as well as external partners.
  • Self-directed with a strong work ethic, with an ability to work in a goal-oriented environment.
  • Proficient computer skills across multiple applications, proven ability to apply statistics into method development and sample analysis; experience with statistical software is a plus.
  • Experience writing MEDDEV 2.7.1 rev 4 and MDR compliant CERs is a plus

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Philips is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status.

As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans’ Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

Apply for job

items.content:
Community Manager

Company: DataQuest
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/2cefddddb2d5-community-manager?source=weworkremotely
At Dataquest, we teach data science to a community of hundreds of thousands of students from all across the world. Our students learn by analyzing real data, and eventually build projects on topics ranging from predicting the stock market to finding the best NBA players. Students all over the world have landed exciting new jobs at companies like SpaceX, Facebook, and Microsoft by using Dataquest. You can read more about our philosophy here, and learn more about what our students think here.

We’re looking for someone who can increase our impact by building excitement and community among our students. This will primarily happen through facilitating workshops where students can learn data science topics, and through helping students connect with Dataquest and ask and answer questions.

We view community as a key component of learning, and we’ve spent quite a bit of time creating office hours where students can ask questions to our data scientists, and a Slack community where students can engage with each other. As a community manager, you’ll build on these efforts to engage our students early on. You’ll add value to the student experience, and help our students reach their learning goals more effectively. You’ll coordinate with our internal content team to create community outreach and engagement around new course launches.

The community engagement you foster will cause more students decide to convert to subscribers, and it will cause subscribers to stick around for longer on the platform. We're looking for someone who's data-driven, passionate about education, and able to understand the motivations of our students.

Dataquest is growing quickly, and this is a chance to join a small team working on a large, socially impactful, problem. You'll have an opportunity to create and iterate on a high impact marketing program.

Responsibilities

  • Devise KPIs and goals for our community outreach
  • Create audience personas that our workshops could be targeted towards
  • Coordinate with our content team to create workshops targeting those personas
  • Coordinate with our content team to build excitement around course launches
  • Manage and improve our office hours program
  • Manage and improve our Slack community
  • Analyze and consider trends in the data science market in order to best position our brand and products
  • Evaluate performance using feedback from students as well as relevant KPIs
  • Become well acquainted with what we teach and how we teach it

Requirements

  • Ability to iterate on community strategy using data
  • Experience managing a community
  • Familiarity with analytics tools like Google Analytics
  • Familiarity with messaging tools like Intercom and Mailchimp
  • Experience working with data to drive marketing decisions
  • Proven experience writing clearly and directly
  • Experience focusing on revenue and performance metrics

Benefits

At Dataquest, you'll get:

  • The opportunity to see your impact on the lives of our students every day
  • The chance to work with an engaged and mission-driven team
  • The chance to contribute to product direction and decisions
  • A supportive environment where you can get help
  • The ability to work remotely and autonomously
  • Unlimited vacation and sick leave
  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits if you're in the US
  • A 401(k) plan
  • The chance to work at a fast-growing company at an early stage

This is a full-time remote role.

Apply for this position

https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/2cefddddb2d5-community-manager?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
Identity Architecture Content Padawan


Auth0


Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!


Auth0 is experiencing tremendous growth, onboarding new technical personnel at breakneck pace. New hires are always excellent professionals, but they often lack a background in identity - and even when they do, they need to ramp up fast on Auth0 features set. We want to capture the essence of how Auth0 solves identity and development problems, and make it available in form of educational material that can be used by our new hires and customers to ramp up as efficiently as possible.


Identity is a complex subject, and making someone productive entails profound understanding of its underlying principles combined with exceptional communication skills. We are recruiting a passionate technical content manager who’s willing to dive deep in identity architecture and product, gain solid understanding of both big picture and fine grained details, and reemerge to explain to non-experts what they need to know to use Auth0 effectively, securely and following industry best practices.


You won’t be alone in this challenge! You can expect to work shoulder to shoulder with world class experts, supercharging your own ramp up in identity, architecture and technical communication. With the kind of knowledge you’ll acquire, you’ll be positioned to decide on what to do next. This is a unique opportunity.


You will:

Design and author exceptional end to end educational content for developer

Define well thought, custom-tailored tables of content, courses structure

Author clarifying code samples and labs

Produce engaging, easy to follow, comprehensive written documentation

Script and deliver engaging video courses

Identify and catalog use cases

Gather tribal knowledge and best practices from existing customer engagements

Deliver classes and workshops  

You might be a good fit for this role if you:

• Have solid development experience (any or all of web, mid tier, mobile). Preferred languages: JS, node, c#, java

• Have an inexhaustible desire to make your audience truly learn and understand, no matter how hard the topic is

• Are an excellent communicator across multiple mediums, in particular written documentation

• Have passion and willingness to go deep on things

• Have had exposure to (or even better, experience in) the challenges of distributed architecture and/or security


Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

See more jobs at Auth0

L&T Co. is an NYC-based brand publishing company focused on creating great content and executing sophisticated multi-channel marketing strategies. We transform company blogs into authoritative trade publications to establish brands as influential industry voices and cultivate deeper digital relationships with partners, clients, and prospects. Inspiral is a venture-backed company that empowers people around the world to share knowledge and skills instantly. Become a cook, fix appliances, assemble furniture - learn any task in seconds. We build practical science fiction to create the dream of instant knowledge. We are a unique founding team featuring a unicorn founder, a growth hacker, and a technology wizard. Additionally, we are fortunate to be joined by an incredible advisory board and support network featuring some of London’s top entrepreneurs.

Inspiral is a venture-backed company that empowers people around the world to share knowledge and skills instantly. Become a cook, fix appliances, assemble furniture - learn any task in seconds. Instant knowledge. Practical science fiction.

We are a unique founding team featuring a unicorn founder (one of the TOP 10 most influential women entrepreneurs), a growth hacker, and a technology wizard. As a cherry on top, we are lucky to be joined by an incredible advisory board and support network featuring some of London’s top entrepreneurs.

As a platform featuring user-generated content, our creator community is the centerpiece of our business. This is why we are looking for a highly proactive community manager to join our small team and help shape the future of instant education.

For this role we ideally look for:
* Passion for tech-for-good products and building something meaningful
* Data-conscious, iterative approach to problem-solving
* Ability to start and foster relationships with a variety of different personalities
* Outgoing personality and proactive attitude towards your work
* Creativity and ability to learn fast

Nice to have’s:
* Enthusiasm for content creation on platforms like Snapchat, Instagram, Youtube
* Experience with kick-starting and managing an online community
* Past projects using social media marketing strategies and tools
* Experience producing content and writing newsletters

In your application please include:
* Any online profiles (LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.)
* A description of your professional experience (LinkedIn, CV, or similar)
* No long cover letter needed (we prefer meeting you)

We love people with experience. But even more, we love people who love our open culture and working together as a team. We are looking for ambitious self-starters with a growth mindset who are enthusiastic about our mission and think on a truly global scale.

You will be working directly together with the co-founding team featuring one of Europe’s top tech entrepreneurs as well as an experienced growth hacker. If you love creating the future of instant education as much as we do - apply now and let’s grab a coffee!

items.title: Deputy Editor
items.content:
Deputy Editor at Clips Nation

Remote

Location: Remote

Vox Media employees thrive on innovation and change while ambitiously seeking to master their subject areas, hone their craft, and improve their communities. We help smart, talented, creative professionals make a meaningful impact in media, technology and the world around them. The Vox Media house of network includes industry-leading media forces like SB Nation, Eater, The Verge, Vox, Curbed, Recode, Racked and Polygon, and reaches an audience of hundreds of millions, generating over a billion content views each month.

Come internet with us!

SB Nation’s NBA team site covering the Los Angeles Clippers is looking for more talent to add to their tremendous staff. We value writers that help enrich discussion on our sites, promote our material on social media and cover everything entailed with basketball. Bring your strong voice and opinions and share your thoughts with the world. Your chance for greatness is at hand.

The Skinny

Joining the exclusive staff of one of our team sites gives you one of the more prominent voices in the basketball community. Team fan bases are always ravenously consuming our material, and you’ll have a chance to speak to the masses through our wide-reaching SB Nation platform.

Some of our staff have used their time with us as a springboard into other professional writing gigs with us and other media companies. While that’s definitely not the goal of everyone here, it’s a beautiful and very real perk for your efforts on the site. Write. Read. Grow.

The Staff We Need-

Deputy Editor

Individual in this role will assist and support the Managing Editor of our Los Angeles Clippers coverage. Key responsibilities include making sure that the site is publishing every day, at a volume high enough for growth. Have the organizational skills to help manage a staff of multiple people. Be able to produce and edit clean copy, as well as provide in-depth analysis on the team. Must be comfortable working in a remote environment.

Some daytime availability, to help ensure daily content is being posted and breaking news is addressed, will be required. Flexibility is preferred. Please share your past experience managing a staff or running a site, in addition to previous work samples, upon applying.

Minimum Qualifications

  • You are a huge fan of basketball and passionate follower of your team and have experience writing about these topics. If you don’t yet have the experience you can join your favorite team site and start writing FanPosts. It’s how many of our writers got their start.
  • You can take the thoughts inside your head and transcribe them into competent arrangements of English words that effectively communicate your idea, i.e., you need to be able to write complete sentences. And more!
  • You have strong opinions on your team that have not been yet been brought to the foreground.
  • You have strong opinions on issues that have already been brought to the foreground but need some additional perspective.
  • You take genuine pride in your writing, your discussions and how you gather facts and data to back them up.
  • You have experience managing a staff and/or running a relevant site.

Preferred qualifications

  • You are an active member of one of our communities who submits FanPosts or FanShots or are very interested in figuring out how the site operates and communicates.
  • You are active on Twitter and/or Facebook, spending time looking for fresh news and analysis of your team.
  • You enjoy discussing your team on our website(s) and want to enrich the discussion in our comments.
  • You are a self-starter, someone who can take initiative with respective tasks.
  • Please provide writing samples and let us know what role you’re interested in upon applying.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds, and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

items.content:
Image Content Specialist – Select US States at FlexJobs

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Responsibilities of the Job

Our content team is looking for an image content specialist to creatively, effectively, and strategically select images that match our blog post content in a powerful way to help increase page views and engagement on both our blog and promotions on social media.

So if you believe that a picture is worth a 1,000 words, and that by matching the right picture with the right article you can create a more enticing experience for a possible reader… this job might be perfect for you!

Who We Are

Our mission is to improve the future of work by helping people find flexible jobs that make their lives better. We are committed to doing this internally and externally with integrity, intelligence, balance, communication, and care.

In the past 11+ years, FlexJobs has established itself as the leader in the professional flexible job market (remote, freelance, part-time, and flexible jobs) to help job seekers connect with employers that offer these highly desired arrangements. We do this in a way that makes the job search experience easier, safer, and faster for job seekers by utilizing both technology and human intelligence to provide a friendly, effective, and better job service.

In terms of flexibility, we also walk the talk! Our entire team works remotely from locations all across the United States. The ability to flex our schedules as needed to best fit our lives allows us to work in a very focused and productive way.

What You’ll Do

  • Search our subscription asset libraries to select images that strongly speak for each blog post with creative connections using logic, humor, fun, and drama, while also keeping an appeal to a diverse audience.
  • Perform light manipulation to customize and size photos as needed.
  • Upload and format images into WordPress.
  • Proof each post image to make sure it is loading and displaying correctly.
  • Format images for social media.

Your Experience

  • A clear knack for and enjoyment in creatively, effectively, and strategically selecting images that match articles in a powerful way to increase interest in the article itself.
  • 2+ years’ experience in social media marketing, marketing, photo editing, or similar would be fantastic, but as this is a unique position, we are open to a variety of backgrounds.
  • A keen understanding for what types of photos perform well on social media, and what kinds can backfire.
  • 1+ years’ experience in photo editing and resizing with file size consideration using tools such as Photoshop, Adobe Spark, or Canva, including resizing, cropping, gradient, and adding text overlay.
  • The ability and commitment to meet deadlines.

Traits Required of All Team Members, You Included

  • You must have reliable high-speed Internet access, a fast computer (desktop or laptop), and phone access. A wired Internet connection (instead of Wi-Fi) is preferred.
  • You must be able to work somewhere between 10-15 hours/week, generally spread pretty evenly Monday-Friday.

How to Apply

If this is sounding a lot like you, then please consider applying! What we’ll need from you:

  1. An intro email/cover letter telling us:
    1. What makes you excited about working for FlexJobs (v. any other company)
    2. What makes you a great fit for this role
    3. A submission of two images that fit the topic “Do Telecommuting Jobs Really Pay Less?”
    4. What hourly rate (based on 10-15 hours/week) you would be comfortable with
  2. A current resume in .doc, .docx, .pdf, or .txt
  3. Applications can be sent through FlexJobs (of course!) or by email to jobs@flexjobs.com.

Important Note

Any applications that don’t include ALL of this information or are a clear half-hearted effort will be put into a “not qualified” group immediately. Sorry to be tough, but we don’t want to waste our time or yours. Hope you understand.

FlexJobs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate and support diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees.

FlexJobs is also a veteran and military spouse-friendly employer. Our positions are perfectly structured for qualified candidates who meet this criteria and we have a workplace culture that supports their work and life.

Open to candidates in select US states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, MN, NC, NH, NY, OK, OR, PA, TN, TX, VA

items.content:
PHP Developer, Technical Content

Developer
Anywhere in US
Company: Twilio
Full Time

Overview

You are a developer. You know how magical code can be when it works and how frustrating it feels when it doesn’t. You enjoy sharing that knowledge with others and you do so with patience and empathy.

You are a storyteller and enjoy helping developers write their own stories about the code they’ve written. You enjoy crafting a narrative with a beginning, middle, and end in the blog posts, emails and documentation that you write. And you enjoy making the code the star of the story so developers can learn how to build what you’ve built.

You care deeply about developers. Your interactions online are grounded in empathy, and you generally prefer to praise in public and criticize in private.

What?

You will review and refactor code and content created by contributors from our community as well as write your own code and technical tutorials that serve as examples for Voices authors.

Your work will involve publishing blog posts and videos that help developers learn how to become better technical writers and identifying trends which shape our content strategy. You’ll write and deploy software to give our small team more leverage, and to make sure that developers reading our blog have the best possible experience.

We’ll measure the results of our work by the number “ah-ha, it worked!” moments that developers have when reading the content we’ve helped others to write.

Why?

Twilio’s mission is to fuel the future of communications.

The Developer Network is the team at Twilio whose mission is to catalyze the network of developers who will build the future of communications. The DevNet is comprised of four teams that work closely with one another: the Developer Evangelists, the Developer Educators, the Community Developers and the Developer Voices team. Together, these four teams introduce developers to Twilio and then strengthen the relationships between us.

Twilio is a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we’re dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This is a remote position, based in a major metro area within the US. While working remote, you will still enjoy our incredible perks: a free Kindle when you build your Twilio app, monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, unlimited PTO, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our , who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

values

Community Manager (Philly) at Food Moves

Philadelphia, Remote · Internship

We are starting something special, we believe in a new age work environment that offers flexibility, respect, balance, and fun. Come help shape our business and grow this into the brand we believe Food Moves can be.

Job Description

Food Moves is the first real-time locator for food trucks and farmers’ markets. We are currently looking for a passionate, hard-working, food-loving, outgoing person to help us add new vendors and grow the community around you.

As the newest addition to our team, you will help bring vendors onto our platform and upsell them on other services and features of Food Moves. In addition, you will act to build the Food Moves community in your area through social media, events, and screaming from the top of a mountain.

We are looking for someone who can really make an impact on our business. We need someone personable with hustle that can generate sales and build relationships. If you like wearing multiple hats and owning your own projects, this is the ideal role for you.

Since Food Moves is a young startup, you will be picking up additional responsibilities on top of onboarding vendors to our platform and helping them where ever they need. There is opportunity everywhere within Food Moves and we need an amazing person to become a key player.

You will be paid in commission and equity may be available for the right candidate.

items.content:
Content Writer at Wordvice

Remote | Freelance | International

Job Description

Wordvice, an international English editing company, is seeking academic professionals with experience in areas of research writing (and/or experience recording and producing educational content) and publishing to write articles for our Resources (blog) page about a variety of academic topics, including research writing, manuscript preparation, academic grammar and formatting guidelines, the journal submission and publishing process, and more.

We are also seeking articles about the college and university admissions process (e.g., personal/admissions essays, Statement of Purpose, MBA essays, scholarship essays, university interviews) or personal admissions experiences, successes, and strategies that may be useful or particularly interesting to those currently applying to college or university.

Sample blog articles from our Resources page:

  • How Many References Should I Use in a Research Paper?
  • 6 Tips for Answering the University of California’s Personal Insight Questions
  • How to Write a Journal Submissions Cover Letter
  • Articles can be found on our Resources page: www.wordvice.com/blog

Responsibilities

  • Draft engaging articles on academic or admissions issues from a list of potential topics we provide; or suggest and write about your own topic (upon approval)
  • Include key relevant information that will be useful to our customers and relevant keywords that will increase our SEO
  • Allow for one request for revision of your content before submitting article
  • Create and submit any accompanying graphics, charts, or captions that can be inserted into our WordPress page

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

  • Previous writing/blogging experience with related content (please share any relevant written work you have posted or published)
  • Qualifications/experience with the given topic about which you are writing

Education

Academic Videos: Master’s degree or higher (preferred);

Admissions videos: Bachelor’s degree or higher (preferred)

  • Excellent previous content will be considered as important, regardless of degree achieved

Preferred Qualifications

  • Writers will ideally have the following positions/experiences:
    • Academic articles: university professors, teachers, researchers, graduate and doctoral students, journal editors, and other academic experts with related experience with academic writing or journal submissions
    • Admissions articles: current or former students who have successfully entered a college or university (sharing their stories/techniques about

Conditions

  • Location: Anywhere
  • Frequency: Contingent on need, expertise, and quality of produced content
  • Duration: Ongoing
  • Payment: Indicate expected pay in application

Hiring Procedure

  • Click [Apply Now] button below to submit an application and upload materials.
  • Your resume and a summary of your past related experience
  • Files or links to writing samples
  • A list of which kinds of topics (academic writing/journal submissions/journal publishing/admissions) you would be interested in writing about
  • Your expected pay per article

Contact

  • content@wordvice.com
Apply for job

items.title: Editor-in-Chief
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Forex Club; 500-1000 employees; 25-50% remote;

SKILLS:
• Content Writing

Forex Club (International broker with 20-year history on financial and cryptocurrency markets) is looking for an Editor-in-Chief (remote work) of Global cryptocurrency news portal.



Responsibilities:

- Define Crypto News Portal (CNP) direction, scope and policy to ensure it is appropriately aligned to the market
- Plan and execute an editorial strategy that grows audiences, leverages multimedia platforms and positions CNP as the leading global source for objective blockchain news and commentary.
- Authority and responsibility for all CNP editorial content, including news, commentary and photography.
- Identify and recruit talented journalists for the CNP editorial team.
- Determine and implement strategies for increasing the quality submissions thus triggering traffic growth
- Promote the Journal and encourage high quality submissions, including review articles
- Manage timely, rigorous and constructive peer-review of articles by a broad range of appropriately chosen international referees
- Lead weekly editorial meetings.
- Encourage appropriate revision of articles and accept only high quality papers that are high impact and/or contribute new and important information to the field
- Represent CNP to crypto community at global Blockchain conferences


Requirements:

- High education degree (Journalism, philological or finance will be a plus)
- Experience as an Editor-in-Chief not less than 3 years in finance sphere (cryptocurrency is desirable).
- Experience in cryptocurrency (in cryptocurrency news portals/sites or in big cryptocurrency projects) and other projects (Journalist, SMM, research and others) is desirable
- Expert knowledge about communication and crypto mass media
- Knowledge about legal issues in crypto world
- Excellent spoken and written English
- Excellent verbal as well as written communicating skills
- Knowledge about quality control analysis
- Effective judgment and decision making skills
- Expert in managing time and completing the given task within the decided time frame
- Creative and innovative
- Ability to tolerate stress and work efficiently even under pressure
Excellent leadership qualities


We offer:

- Work in the reliable and stable well-known company
- Remote and full time work.
- Competitive salary and bonus
- Work in the friendly professional team
- Unique international corporate culture

Los Angeles, Remote · Internship
At Vocatio we're a startup committed to making a huge innovation and social impact around career discovery, exploration and preparation for students of all types from 16-25 yrs old. Unfortunately, it takes more than just getting into a good school and getting good grades to uncover satisfying job and career opportunities.Read More

At Vocatio we're a startup committed to making a huge innovation and social impact around career discovery, exploration and preparation for students of all types from 16-25 yrs old. Unfortunately, it takes more than just getting into a good school and getting good grades to uncover satisfying job and career opportunities.

On the flip side, businesses of all types need young entry-level talent (including us @ Vocatio) to improve their competitiveness. However, finding young "talent that fits" with the unique dynamics of each company is a huge challenge and the resulting "mishires" cost companies more than $15B each year.

If you're an energetic self-starter who wants to make a difference; and if you love consumer media, technology and product design -- please reach out and let's have a conversation.

Applied

An all around ground floor opportunity for an intern to grab the bull by the horns and take on major Editor responsibility for developing and programming the content for our Career Group communities. You will also get the opportunity to manage the user engagement for the Career Group communities.

An awesome learning experience that could lead to FT opportunity. If you have a drive and desire to build from the bottom up and to collaborate with others who are trying to make a cultural impact for young people... then we're your opportunity.

What We're Building

VOCATIO is a vocationally themed media network & talent marketplace designed to:

(1) engage (millennial) students in meaningful career readiness through career and employer aligned content, game based learning, social media & events;
(2) promote job roles, industries & employers to targeted profiled students;
(3) match students with employer opportunities via a proprietary career readiness & engagement algorithm.

VOCATIO integrates career Curriculum, Content & Community programming through a beautifully designed mobile & web platform to lifecycle students through career discovery, exploration, readiness and advancement.

After facilitating meaningful and measurable career engagement among students, the resulting data is captured & leveraged through a proprietary career alignment algorithm to personalize and match student career profiles to job roles, industries, & employer opportunities of all types – internships, contractor/project-based work, and part-time and full-time jobs.
