items.title: Content Creation for Health & Wellbeing App
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re looking to hire a phenomenal Content Creator to work with us on Earthmiles’ exciting mission! At Earthmiles, we’re helping people be healthier and happier – and have some fun on the way. Earthmiles app uses gamification-based behaviour modification tools to incentivise healthier living. We are a 9-member team of passionate and high energy people who want to make a real difference.

If you’re looking to work in a creative and driven team, being involved in something with massive social impact, this is the place for you. If you have a passion for health & fitness, you will identify with our mission even more.

As our Content Creator, you will be responsible for a lot of the content that appears within our two mobile platforms - Earthmiles and Earthmiles@Work. Your content will also be distributed across our other channels such as our website's blog, our company's LinkedIn page and client newsletters.

The blog pieces would be well-researched, unbiased articles covering a variety of cutting edge topics relating to various aspects of health & wellbeing. You will use your keen intuition and tendency to find the "right word" to create informative, educational but enjoyable pieces of content in various formats.

We can also create a secondary opportunity for you to collaborate with our business development team, sales team, or client launch events team to have another aspect to your role and develop your skills more broadly.

There is a lot of potential for flexibility and independence in the role to be a driven, self-starting entrepreneurial person. However you will have structured guidance and a lot of input from the senior team. If you can work very hard and take a lot of responsibility, we will encourage you to run with things independently. At Earthmiles we don’t believe in micromanaging, but in each person pulling their own weight. We aim to provide an environment that fosters your personal development and a competitive salary commensurate with your experience and skills.

Must-haves:

Native-level written and spoken English communication skills. Very good grammar is a must.
Organised, with really good attention to detail (i.e. checking your own work and making sure you are happy with your output. Holding yourself to a very high standard.)
A flair for finding the right word, and / or written sense of humour / ability to write “on-brand” messages would be a bonus
An ability to do grounds-up research to put together content on a variety of topics (e.g. sleep, nutrient deficiency, etc) from trusted (cited) resources
An enthusiasm for hard work and building something amazing (“mission-driven”)
A passion for people, health and wellbeing, and making a difference

Good-to-haves:

An eye for design aesthetics, and some basic skills in putting together digital content using Adobe Photoshop or other clients would be a bonus
A demonstrable interest in startups
Experience in use of MailChimp-style email clients, etc. would be an added bonus
Love for health, fitness, and wellbeing, and a deep interest in these topics
A creative eye, and a love for writing. An ability to write all week, hit deadlines and create a specified amount of content.
-------------------------
Please respond to this opportunity with a Word or PDF version of your CV, a short paragraph in your email explaining what attracted you to this role and why you believe you would be suitable for it.
Please remember to include your contact email and phone number in your email or your CV so we can get in touch with you

items.title: Senior Writer
items.content:
Senior Writer at Aha!

Remote

Do you love writing about how people innovate and build winning products? Does double-spacing make your eye twitch? We are looking for a self-starter with proven editorial and technical chops. Someone who can bring both big-picture pitches and eagle-eyed attention to detail — with a product management angle. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As a Senior Writer at Aha!, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of Silicon Valley veterans whose last two businesses were acquired by well-known public companies. More than 150,000 users trust Aha! to link their brilliant strategy to their team’s work and create visual roadmaps.

We are looking for someone who:

  • Has experience in a B2B SaaS or technology company
  • Is deeply familiar with product management
  • Writes exceptionally well (and has the clips to prove it)
  • Has proven research skills
  • Dreams about the best way to tell a story
  • Has a deep interest in a diverse mix of content topics, including but not limited to: product management, software development, innovation, and startups
  • Is bold, likes to interact with customers, and takes on increasing levels of responsibility

We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:

  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
  • Has a “can do” attitude and a background of delivering superb work again and again
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity and a proven, results-oriented team which has sold multiple software companies

We are building a distributed team, and you can work from anywhere in the United States for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit-sharing program to the right candidates.

For immediate consideration, please contact us at Marketing-jobs@aha.io. If you have the right background, we will quickly follow up with you. We are not working with recruiters or third-party agencies.

Apply for job

items.content:
Technical Documentation Writer

Location: Remote Stoke Upon Trent UK
Role and job type: ️ Content Full-time

Job Description

As a Technical Documentation Writer, you will work closely with our global team to create and maintain content that enables our users to do amazing things with Radix. You will work with product managers, developers, quality engineers, developer advocates, technical support, and marketing to create content that not only provides useful information but also serves to enhance the overall user experience.

Your main responsibilities are:

  • Interview project team members, subject matter experts, customers, and product support to determine required technical and user information.
  • From planning to delivery, you will work with stakeholders to plan and document new features/APIs. You will be responsible for creating appropriate content in the form of concepts and architecture guides, developer guides, code samples, language references, API references, and other online material such as training videos.
  • Translate technical and complex concepts into concise and comprehensive instructions and explanations.
  • Opinions on what technologies and standards we should use now and in the future, we always want to hear new ideas.
  • Review and edit documents written by other staff and work with non-writers on ways to improve their writing skills and contributions to documentation.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Implementation, consistent delivery, and on-going improvement of live and virtual training programs.
  • Work closely with the support and implementation teams to identify areas of improvement in product training and documentation.
  • Research and write documentation that is technically accurate, consistent, appropriate for the audience, and consistent with our writing style.
  • Create product style sheets and style guides to ensure consistency between multiple authors and products.
  • Make customer-requested changes/edits to existing documentation, as appropriate.
  • Prior experience with startups and working with agile, cross-functional teams is a plus. In-depth knowledge about DLT or blockchain technology is not required, but candidates should generally be interested in the technologies poised to transform the way we live and be open to learning deeply about blockchain topics.

Must have:

  • A minimum of 3 years of technical writing experience on enterprise infrastructure software technologies, preferably with a database or data management software development focus.
  • Experience with multimedia with a proven ability to translate complex software processes into an easy to understand multimedia format such as infographics or short videos.
  • Able to read/write/execute basic sample code written in one or more of the following programming languages: Java, Javascript, Python.
  • General knowledge of SEO and marketing analytics best practices.
  • Have done and like to do demonstrably hard things
  • Opinions on what technologies and standards we should use now and in the future, we always want to hear new ideas.
  • Interest in DLT/Blockchain Technologies.

Nice to have:

  • Working knowledge of HTML or JavaScript.
  • Knowledge of DLT/blockchain technology such as decentralization and cryptographic protocols.
  • Knowledge and experience with a relational/NoSQL database
  • Knowledge of git, branching, continuous integration and modern development pipelines.
  • Strong visual and aesthetic sense.
  • Great interpersonal skills and a willingness to go above and beyond when collaborating with the rest of the team.

Benefits:

  • £30-45K salary. We know it’s the people that make a startup win and fail and we recognise that in our benefits.
  • Flexible working - our normal working hours are 9 to 6 but we trust you to manage your time if something different works for you.
  • 3 months located with our CTO, Dan, in Stoke, England. After this period, you may locate anywhere
  • To be part of something amazing. We’re creating friction free access to the digital economy and it’s going to change the world

Salary range

£30-45K

We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.

We're passionate about our work and are looking to find others who are interested in building solutions for an emerging, digitally-integrated economy. 

Please see our website for current opportunities. https://consensys.net/open-positions/

Applied
Apply to ConsenSys
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About Organizational Development & Global Operations at ConsenSys

Consensys is developing itself as a self organizing system. ConsenSys believes that this is the only way we can be nimble and innovative enough to stay in the lead of the blockchain field. Project DNA combines our Organizational Development & Global Operations Circles. Our goal is to facilitate the development of a self-organizing ecosystem that is agile, scalable, representative and transparent. We coordinate the creation of the mindsets, structures and skillsets needed for self-organization at the individual, team, and company-wide level.

About the role

The Self-Management Curriculum Designer/Content Creator will be a key builder of content in order to help our team improve our ability to scale and move towards a decentralized organization. You will be instrumental in establishing the design of the curriculum, building and curating content for Decentralized Organizations 101. You will play an integral role internally in our people’s self-management journey as well as sharing with the world what we are doing organizationally at ConsenSys. You will be a critical driver to our ability to scale and move towards a decentralized operating system.

Responsibilities

Define objectives for various courses
Outline the concept for a course or curriculum, defining (needs for) the course medium, content delivery, assessments, accompanying materials, and complementary learning approaches
Synthesize, build and write course content based on input from subject matter experts, written material, previous training courses, interviews, etc.
Use PowerPoint/Keynote to draft screen layouts, graphics and interactions appropriate to the content
Write the audio script for each course and work with subject matter experts
Work with subject matter experts to design evaluation and measurement systems to achieve learning objectives
Facilitate production process (graphics, animations, audio & editing)
Work with subject matter experts and course sponsors to collect feedback and integrate it into the next course draft
Proof course at multiple stages of development and make or document required changes
Define project schedules and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Keep track of project tasks and status using defined methods
Complete various training, project management, and administrative tasks as needed
Participate in the team’s Agile sprint planning meetings to help define goals and direction
Provide insight into the latest learning tools, trends, and ideas

Requirements

You have exceptional written communication skills and preferably experience developing copy and copy editing content
You have experience in instructional design/curriculum design
You are user-centered in your approach on everything
You take an Agile, experimental approach in problem-solving
Passionate about and have experience in building the “future of work”, e.g. Teal organizations, self-management, movement building
Able to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with teammates, community members, vendors, and partners
Comfortable with ambiguity, yet driven to create order out of chaos
Resourceful self-starter
Focused and scrupulous about details
Demonstrated desire and drive to be a recognized thought leader within the larger Self-Management or Movement-Building community
Comfortable with working in a remote-first environment
Up to 30% travel

Experience with startups, or working at a non-traditional corporate organization or nonprofit is preferred. Knowledge about blockchain & Ethereum is not required, but candidates should be interested in the technologies poised to transform the way we live, and be open to learning deeply about blockchain topics.

Instructional Design., Curriculum Development

items.title: Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese
items.content:
Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese

Company: Legalcom

We’re looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about a wide range of topics, including legal topics.

Most of our work is on legal topics. All topics related to legal are entry-level and not at an academic level.

You’ll be writing about everything from why a certain legal contract is required for a business to writing a checklist article of best tools to use for an e-commerce store to increase sales.

About The Work

We understand the value of quality content. We’re not looking for plain text articles, but well-researched articles to educate our customers: articles with images, links, quotes from research papers, expert’s quotes etc.

Our articles are often 1000+ words, generally around 2,000 words. Some articles are beyond 10,000 words.

We’re not looking to game search engines, but rather educate our customers about the legal contracts they’re searching for. We aim to be a teacher to our customers.

We are looking for writers available for a minimum of one day/week. We have as much work as you can handle. We don’t micromanage.

We are very clear on what we want for every article. We provide topics with a proposed structure including due dates and the minimum required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth during the revision session. But for the most part: you write the article, turn it in, we review and ask for edits if necessary and then publish it.

Writers get paid every other week, in US dollars by PayPal.

Depending on where we’ll publish your work, and for as much as we can, we’ll show your bio byline to give you author credits.

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have English Proficiency qualification.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well organized and reliable
  • Some degree of technical proficiency (Google Docs, taking screenshots)

It’s a major plus if you have any of the following:

  • Legal degree or paralegal experience

How Do We Work?

We work remotely. We don’t need to sync time zones.

We work over Google Docs and email.

How To Apply?

Please format your subject line as follows: “Your Name | Freelance Writer | WhereverJobs” (example: John Doe | Freelance Writer | WhereverJobs).

Send an email to office@legalcom.group with:

  • A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit

items.content:
Content Engineer (Content Modeling, Metadata, Markup,Topology,Schema,Taxonomy)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: IT Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: [A] | No office location

Technologies

taxonomy
metadata
schema
content-management-system
ontology

Job description

Do you love making content intelligent? We are looking for content engineers to help make the world smarter with intelligent content.

[A] seeks motivated candidates with experience in some of the following area. This is a client-facing role and we’re looking for candidates with a mix of experience in some of the following content disciplines:

  • Modeling
  • Metadata
  • Markup
  • Topology
  • Schema
  • Taxonomy

The role will involve work from mostly your home office but may involve occasional travel to a client location. Candidate must be a resident of the United States.

The Content Engineer will work with our practice to craft intelligent content structure for multi-channel marketing and increase the value of semantically rich content. You will participate in, or lead, client projects surrounding customer experience management and personalization.

You’ll define content structure, metadata, content reuse planning, taxonomy, and other content relationships. This includes syndication strategy, search engine optimization (SEO) factors, semantic web schemas, and implementation planning for the CEM / CMS platforms such as Sitecore, Adobe, Kentico, and Episerver.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Structuring content through building content models, taxonomies and metadata definitions
  • Leading client discovery onsite, gathering details and organized data about the current state and desired future state
  • Educating clients on the value of intelligent content, workflows around Content Engineering, and related topics meant to build a client’s internal resources and capabilities
  • Bridging the gap for clients between content strategy, the CMS platforms, operations, and other customer experience technologies
  • Collaborate on information architecture and UX prototyping
  • Determine schema strategy and structural rules

Skills We Are Looking For 
Not all listed skills are required for this role. We are looking for somebody who is experienced in some of the following areas.

  • Exceptional writing, facilitation, and communication skills (required)
  • Detail oriented, organized, self-motivated (required)
  • Collaborate well across distributed team (required)
  • Experience with content models, taxonomies, schemas, adaptive content
  • Experience with any/all of the following: marketing software, content management systems (CMS), customer experience management systems (CEM), DITA, SEO, the semantic web
  • Working understanding of the digital publishing stack including HTML5, CSS, JSON and related JavaScript systems



Learn more about [A] at simplea.com.

Apply now

About [A]

[A] is the Content Intelligence Service.

[A] is a distributed, private, professional services firm that provides strategic support for building content intelligence practices into organizations. [A] helps complex organizations establish content engineering standards and practices to compete in a multichannel, multimodal, AI-driven world.

[A] engineers intelligent content systems for CMS/CEM platforms, and offers integration, training, workshops and custom development. [A] helps clients value content as an enterprise asset, and enables future-ready content through use of the Master Content Model.

What’s Your Name, [A]gain?

Our name is easy. Just say “A.” The [A] brackets represent markup, microdata, content intelligence. The letter “[A]” represents the start, initiation, beginning of change. We are going to help change the world with intelligent content.

Cultural Fit at [A]

  • You love learning, you love teaching.
  • You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you.
  • You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better.
  • You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind-the-scenes.
  • You are self-organized and manage time and resources well.
  • You work alone well but communicate well within a team.

[A] Team Benefits

Being an [A]gent comes with its benefits. Work from anywhere. Advance your career on the leading-edge of the content and technology sciences. Earn a competitive salary, and for longtime [A]gents, participation in a profit-sharing plan. But many [A]gents find the best part of working as an [A]gent are the other [A]gents you work with and the culture at [A].

We take care of each other and we honor each other's work and contributions to the team. We work to make ourselves better and our [A] team better. We make efforts to adapt new technologies and methodologies that can help us optimize our time, and we expect you to collaborate on these efforts if you’re an expert on any of those fields. We communicate and reach out to other [A] players.  We love learning. We love teaching. We write. We code. We support each other. For the right people, working at [A] feels like coming home. 

Benefits

  • Remote Workforce
  • Competitive salary
  • Shared company performance incentives
  • Individual training budget
  • A well-documented career path
  • Flexible hours & personal independence
  • Other benefits based on location.
  • 401K

items.title: 50 Essay Writers Needed
items.content:
50 Essay Writers Needed

Company: WritePal Global Inc.
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Contract

Description

Hello,

I'm in need of about 50 additional essay writers on my team at myessaywriter.net and our soon-to-be launched uwritemyessay.net. We will have an unlimited amount of work starting in September. We currently receive about 10-15 orders per day during the summer months. We have 80 writers.

This is reliable work that averages about $21/hour. This assumes you are a savvy writer who can write about three double-spaced pages per hour.

Please apply only if you are familiar with APA and MLA citation styles. Please send a sample and a resume.

This is reliable work that can be whatever you make of it. You can work full time, part time, or on a casual basis. You decide your own hours and you work from home.

If you are added to the team, you have access to an article queuing system where assignments are immediately sent. Once you claim a project, the assignment will be added to your account.

Payment is made on a weekly basis.

Application Instructions

Please submit an APA or MLA sample and your resume upon applying.

items.content:
Fashion & Beauty Writer

Writing
Anywhere in US
Company: Bustle
Part Time

Overview

Bustle’s Fashion & Beauty team is seeking a  In addition to reporting on mainstream fashion and beauty news, writers will cover style stories that impact people of marginalized communities (including people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, people with disabilities, and plus size individuals.)

Fashion & Beauty Writer.

We’re specifically looking for experienced writers with knowledge of how privilege and inequality impacts the fashion and beauty spheres. Writers are expected to stay embedded in the fashion and beauty news cycle, and pitch angles relevant to the Bustle reader.

Writers must be able to work for six hour shifts at least three days a week between Monday and Friday. In addition to reporting responsibly on sensitive topics, accuracy is key for this role. The job is fast-paced, so be ready for breaking news like unexpected product launches or celebrity style changes at any moment.

Interested writers should also be familiar with Bustle’s voice and mission, and be ready to pitch a few ideas during the hiring process.

Responsibilities
  • Identifying and pitching timely beauty and fashion stories
  • Writing and reporting three to four light-lift news stories per shift
  • Finding original content such as viral trends and smaller brands to cover before anyone else

    • Requirements
    • A passion for all things fashion and beauty
    • A strong writing voice full of personality and confidence
    • A knowledge of privilege and inequality as it applies to fashion and beauty
    • 2+ years of editorial experience (personal blogs count!)
    • Availability to work remotely at least two days a week during business hours Monday — Friday

      • Bustle Digital Group is the largest premium publisher reaching millennial women. Every month, nearly 80 million readers turn to Bustle Digital Group publications — Bustle, Romper, Elite Daily, and The Zoe Report — for impactful conversation around the interests and issues engaging women today. Focusing on everything from pop culture to parenthood, Bustle Digital Group’s content leverages the power of a diverse set of voices from coast to coast. Bustle Digital Group does business with over 300 global brands, and ranks among the most popular media companies with our demographic on social media. Bustle Digital Group was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in New York City, with offices in Los Angeles and London.

items.content:
Associate Entertainment News Editor, Evenings

Writing
Anywhere in US (LA or NYC Preferred)
Company: Bustle
Full Time

Overview

Elite Daily is seeking a full-time  to join its Entertainment team. This editor will manage a team of writers, assist in live event coverage (including, but not limited to: TV shows, new music and album releases, award shows, celebrity relationships news, baby news, and more), conduct interviews, and work to ensure that Elite Daily’s timely, thoughtful, and unique celebrity coverage is humorous, relatable, and wholly on brand. Elite Daily is looking someone who can anticipate viral moments and theories in TV shows and movies. The Associate Entertainment News Editor must understand which shows are important to Elite Daily’s audience and be able to deliver articles from the point of view our readers want.

Associate Entertainment News Editor

Are you an entertainment junkie who can name every Kylie Jenner lip kit? Do you daydream about what went wrong in Selena Gomez and Justin Bieber’s relationship? Are you just as comfortable figuring out what the heck is going on in Game of Thrones as you are dissecting a Jersey Shore: Family Vacation squabble? Do you know the details of Taylor Swift’s new album before anyone else? Is your free time spent searching through her lyrics for hidden pop culture references? If so, then Elite Daily’s Associate Entertainment News Editor position is just for you.

Interested candidates should be extremely responsive to the 24/7 news cycle, eager to deliver the news to like-minded readers quickly and expertly, thrive in breaking entertainment news situations, and display an ability to confidently take a trending topic and use it as inspiration for creative, original, and fun content.

This position is full-time, and based remotely; however, NYC or LA based candidates are preferred.

Responsibilities
  • Manage a team of 3-5 writers and their daily news coverage (including story selection, headlines, and angles)
  • Edit daily news stories and evergreen content
  • Sweep the internet for relevant news that would appeal to the Elite Daily audience and identify unique angles on those stories
  • Assist in coverage of live and breaking events
  • Work closely with Elite Daily’s TV & Movies Editor to ensure we have full coverage on all the shows our audience loves
  • Identify new shows and movies that Elite Daily readers will be excited to watch and read about

    • Requirements
    • 1-2 years editing or writing experience, preferably in entertainment
    • Must be available to work evenings Monday-Friday
    • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
    • A deep understanding and passion for celebrities and the entertainment industry
    • The ability to generate, assign, and edit an array of celebrity topics quickly and efficiently
    • Some experience managing writers
    • Pitch-perfect news judgment

      • Bustle Digital Group is the largest premium publisher reaching millennial women. Every month, nearly 80 million readers turn to Bustle Digital Group publications — Bustle, Romper, Elite Daily, and The Zoe Report — for impactful conversation around the interests and issues engaging women today. Focusing on everything from pop culture to parenthood, Bustle Digital Group’s content leverages the power of a diverse set of voices from coast to coast. Bustle Digital Group does business with over 300 global brands, and ranks among the most popular media companies with our demographic on social media. Bustle Digital Group was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in New York City, with offices in Los Angeles and London.

items.content:
Copywriter

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: Coffee Meets Bagel
ContractFull TimePart Time

Overview

Coffee Meets Bagel’s mission is to inspire singles to share and connect authentically. The app curates quality matches with fuller profiles that result in real conversations. Globally, CMB has generated millions of real dates and thousands of lasting relationships. Coffee Meets Bagel was named one of the Top 10 Dating apps by Time Magazine and the Best Dating App for Women by Refinery29. It has also been voted the #1 recommended dating app for singles looking for relationships.

CMB is currently seeking to hire our very first in-house copywriter. This is a very flexible position that can be done part -time/contract or full- time, on-site or remotely. If you are a great candidate and want to work part time/contract, we are willing to reduce the scope of work to make that possible.

As the first copywriter to join CMB, you’ll drive the creative strategy and messaging for all of CMB’s product and marketing communications.

Our job is to enable our members to not just meet people, but to meet the right person for their life-stage and journey and fulfill on their larger desire to grow and take the next steps in life.  The role will play a key role in making our brand story come alive via precise, sticky, and unique voice in all of our product and marketing efforts.

You’ll collaborate with marketing managers, product managers, designers, social media managers, PR strategist, and the founders, in a fast-paced, rapidly-growing environment— to re-ignite enthusiasm towards dating for people around the world.

Responsibilities:
  • Write, edit, and proofread high-quality, on-brand copy for all channels: product, email, landing pages, in-app, push notifications, SMS messages, social media posts, collaterals for events.
  • Write and edit blog content based on briefs and/or interviews.
  • Collaborate with marketing team members to develop strategic solutions against marketing briefs. Question marketing briefs to push things forward.
  • Leverage research and insights to develop communications that meet our customers’ desires and needs.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams (product, marketing, customer experience) to execute projects.
  • A/B test copy across different channels.
  • Work through multiple review rounds efficiently, managing stakeholders, and working with designers to finish projects on time.
  • Manage your projects from start to finish; checking in with your creative lead to ensure copy meets expectations.
  • Be able to contribute creative ideas, take creative direction, and be flexible.
  • Present your work to creative leads and project stakeholders.
  • Pitch new ideas for marketing campaigns.

    • Qualifications:
    • 2+ years of experience as a copywriter for an advertising agency or in-house for a consumer brands that heavily uses digital channels.
    • An ability to adapt to a new tone of voice, helping to define and push it forward.
    • An ability to make complex product concept and marketing programs sound simple.
    • Organized, solid copy editor, excellent proofreader. Meticulous about spelling and punctuation, extreme attention to detail.
    • A good understanding of how design and copy work together.
    • Organization skills; you can effectively manage your time and prioritize your workload.
    • An ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with a broad in-house team.
    • Experience conceiving campaign ideas, collaborating with design and brand teams.
    • A track record managing your own workload efficiently.
    • Familiarity with Google Docs and Slides.

      • To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.lever.co/coffeemeetsbagel/e3f9b524-edca-4695-899a-803aef4e8197 →

items.content:
Photography Writer

Company: Digital Photography School
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

One of the world’s largest photography blogs www.Digital-Photography-School.com (dPS) is seeking photographers to join our remote writing team!

 

You need to be able to submit two articles per month or more about helpful photography tips and techniques. Your articles need to be of a high-quality, demonstrate a deep knowledge of digital photography and include your own original images.

 

Ideally, we’re looking for people with heaps of photography experience (profession or semi-pro) and/or teaching and instructing experience. Some knowledge of WordPress and online writing is beneficial also.

 

dPS aims to help beginner to intermediate photographers to improve their photography through well written, informative content including topics such as:

  • Composition
  • Camera settings and techniques
  • How to use gear
  • Post-processing
  • Photo tutorials about various topics including: weddings, portraiture, sports, landscapes, street photography, wildlife, events, flash photography, etc.

 

Our articles need to focus on: how to, photography tips, or tutorial content. The more practical the better as they will be more useful to new photographers. If you have a high quality image library of your own pictures to use as examples in articles and have a very strong grasp of the English language (if it’s not your native language you must show a proficiency in English in your communication and/or trial) this will be especially advantageous.

 

So if you can:

  • Provide a link to your high quality professional photography portfolio
  • Show photography writing and/or teaching experience (do you lead photography workshops, write tutorials, write a photography blog? etc.)
  • Commit to writing at least two quality articles per month
  • Teach others about photography in a friendly, technical but easy-to-understand style

 

Apply today at.....

http://digital-photography-school.com/writingapplication Include: your name, a paragraph about  your relevant experience, at least one sample of your writing on digital photography, some suggested post titles/topics that you feel you'd be able to cover, and any other relevant information

Please make this submission by midnight (EST NYC time) August 31st, 2018.

Note that last time this was advertised we had a large number of applicants and it took some time to process. Once the cut off date arrives we will collate the responses and shortlist the most appropriate applicants.

 

Shortlisted candidates will be invited to submit a trial post to be used on dPS (you will be remunerated for this) to see how it is received by readers and to let you see if it is a fit for you too. After all shortlisted candidates trial posts are published you will be notified as to whether your application has been successful or not. Please note: this process can take several weeks. This is a paid position (per post) as part of a dynamic writing team of photographers based all around the world. You will also receive additional promotion of your own photographic projects in your bylines on our popular site which reaches millions of readers around the world each month.

Application Instructions

Include: your name, a paragraph about  your relevant experience, at least one sample of your writing on digital photography, some suggested post titles/topics that you feel you'd be able to cover, and any other relevant information

Please make this submission by midnight (EST NYC time) August 31st, 2018.

Note that last time this was advertised we had a large number of applicants and it took some time to process. Once the cut off date arrives we will collate the responses and shortlist the most appropriate applicants.

items.title: Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese
items.content:
Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese


Legalcom

 verified
We're looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about a wide range of topics, including legal topics.

Most of our work is on legal topics. All topics related to legal are entry-level and not at an academic level.

You'll be writing about everything from why a certain legal contract is required for a business to writing a checklist article of best tools to use for an e-commerce store to increase sales.

**About The Work**

We understand the value of quality content. We're not looking for plain text articles, but well-researched articles to educate our customers: articles with images, links, quotes from research papers, expert's quotes etc.

Our articles are often 1000+ words, generally around 2,000 words. Some articles are beyond 10,000 words.

We're not looking to game search engines, but rather educate our customers about the legal contracts they're searching for. We aim to be a teacher to our customers.

We are looking for writers available for a minimum of one day/week. We have as much work as you can handle. We don't micromanage.

We are very clear on what we want for every article. We provide topics with a proposed structure including due dates and the minimum required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth during the revision session. But for the most part: you write the article, turn it in, we review and ask for edits if necessary and then publish it.

Writers get paid every other week, in US dollars by PayPal.

Depending on where we'll publish your work, and for as much as we can, we'll show your bio byline to give you author credits.

Responsibilities

* Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have English Proficiency qualification.* Exceptional online research skills* Well organized and reliable* Some degree of technical proficiency (using Google Docs, taking screenshots)It’s a major plus if you have any of the following:* Legal degree or paralegal experience

Requirements

Please format your subject line as follows: "Your Name | Freelance Writer | Remote OK" (example: John Doe | Freelance Writer | Remote OK).Send an email to office@legalcom.group with:* A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit* 3 URLs showcasing your work related to internet laws or technology* Your freelance writing ratesWe look forward to hearing from you!

See more jobs at Legalcom

Job Description

The restaurant scout finds great new restaurants for Forkable and helps us input them into our system. Sometimes you'll need to try the food out to make sure it's up to snuff.

What We're Building

Forkable is using AI to conquer the 834B global lunch market. It figures out what you want for lunch before you know it, automatically delivering the best local restaurants to your whole office. A unique copay system makes Forkable accessible to companies with a wide variety of budgets.

By solving the group ordering problem we are able to source from a wide variety of local restaurants with 20x lower delivery costs than normal.

items.content:
Hiring Editor for a Tech Blog

Company: Guiding Tech
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Part-time

Description

Guiding Tech is looking for a part-time Editor who will be responsible for proofreading, fact-checking and scheduling articles for publication on the website.

You'd be required to devote around 3 hours every day, from Monday to Friday. You can be anywhere in the world but since we have an office in India and have full-time staff here, we need you to spend your working hours between 10 AM to 7 PM IST (Indian standard time).

The ideal candidate is a geek whose life revolves around gadgets, apps, web based tools and other aspects of consumer tech, someone who spends time obsessing about the smallest of details and reading top tech sites and watching quality tech YouTube channels.

Needless to say, impeccable written English skills are a must.

Prior experience as the Editor (or a Senior Writer) of a tech site is a must.

You'll be paid a fixed salary every month, via Paypal or wire transfer if outside India, and via bank transfer if in India.

Apply using the link below or email abhijeet at guidingtech dot com mentioning details about your work experience and why you think you're the right fit for this job.

items.title: Growth Copywriter
items.content:
Growth Copywriter

Company: Ladder

We are looking for an ambitious, experienced copywriter who has the potential and determination to become a world-class expert in writing content to help grow companies.

  • Must have a portfolio of previous work to showcase your ability, accessible online
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a copywriting role at a fast-growing company.
  • Capacity for critical thinking and employing strategy to hit business goals.
  • Expected to flex your creative muscles and take full responsibility for performance.
  • Interested in mastering all aspects of copywriting (ads, website, blogs, emails).
  • Certifications via online or in-person digital marketing courses are a plus.

Growth Copywriter Role

You’ll work directly with the strategy team to plug in remotely as a copywriter at Ladder for our clients. You will own any copywriting briefs that get assigned to you, defining the strategy and handling execution, taking advice from the team and escalating issues to the Account Director as needed. Because your work will be reviewed directly by founders and senior managers at startups and large enterprises, the work environment is demanding and fast-paced.

To support your continuing development, we have an in-depth training plan based on our blog content and online courses we have subscriptions to. Our in-house software helps make your client briefs easier to manage, and it has hundreds of growth tactics to help you generate ideas from what's worked before for similar clients. Along the way, you will be expected to communicate progress clearly and confidently to the rest of the Ladder team. You will also be involved in training and recruiting new hires.

Future Development

You will start on smaller clients initially, increasingly working on more strategic clients as you get comfortable with our process and show your ability to produce high quality work. After your first year you will be eligible for promotion to the Senior Growth Copywriter role, which comes with a pay rise and additional supervisory / training responsibilities. 18 months in, our goal is for you to be a notable rising star within the copywriting community. As well as the training program and support from the team, Ladder’s leadership team will be actively coaching you and helping you carve out your own role as the company expands.

Team Culture

You will be based remotely, but can work from our New York City, London or Wroclaw offices when desired for this role. Dress code is informal (jeans and t-shirts are fine) but professional if you're in the office, as we often have clients visiting. We encourage remote employees to visit one of our offices each quarter and will pay for your travel within reason.

We will often pay for team lunches on special occasions / dinner if we’re working late. We host regular happy hours, game nights and other team events. Our meme game is strong and we all have custom slack emojis / obscure nicknames. We have a strong culture of supporting each other with client or strategy issues, and bouncing ideas back and forth.

If you’re a hard worker and are genuinely interested in finding innovative ways to help companies grow, you’ll love it here!
How to apply:
Email a link to your portfolio to mike@ladder.io with the subject line "Hire me as a Copywriter", and the body a 1-2 line description of why you'd be perfect for the role.

items.title: Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese
items.content:
Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese

Company: Legalcom Group
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

We’re looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about a wide range of topics, including legal topics.

Most of our work is on legal topics. All topics related to legal are entry-level and not at an academic level.

You’ll be writing about everything from why a certain legal contract is required for a business to writing a checklist article of best tools to use for an e-commerce store to increase sales.

 

About The Work

We understand the value of quality content. We’re not looking for plain text articles, but well-researched articles to educate our customers: articles with images, links, quotes from research papers, expert’s quotes etc.

Our articles are often 1000+ words, generally around 2,000 words. Some articles are beyond 10,000 words.

We’re not looking to game search engines, but rather educate our customers about the legal contracts they’re searching for. We aim to be a teacher to our customers.

We are looking for writers available for a minimum of one day/week. We have as much work as you can handle. We don’t micromanage.

We are very clear on what we want for every article. We provide topics with a proposed structure including due dates and the minimum required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth during the revision session. But for the most part: you write the article, turn it in, we review and ask for edits if necessary and then publish it.

Writers get paid every other week, in US dollars by PayPal.

Depending on where we’ll publish your work, and for as much as we can, we’ll show your bio byline to give you author credits.

 

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have English Proficiency qualification.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well organized and reliable
  • Some degree of technical proficiency (Google Docs, taking screenshots)

It’s a major plus if you have any of the following:

  • Legal degree or paralegal experience

 

How Do We Work?

We work remotely. We don’t need to sync time zones.

We work over Google Docs and email.

 

How To Apply?

Please format your subject line as follows: Your Name | Freelance Writer | ProBlogger (example: John Doe | Freelance Writer | ProBlogger).

Please send an email to [email protected] with:

  • A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit
  • 3 URLs showcasing your work related to internet laws or technology
  • Your freelance writing rates

We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: iPhone Photography Writers Needed
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=20, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=20, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
iPhone Photography Writers Needed

Company: iPhone Photography School
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Attention Expert iPhone Photographers:

“Get Paid To Help Millions Of People Improve Their iPhone Photography!”

  • If you want to get paid to combine your passion for photography and writing...
  • If you want to get high-profile exposure as a photographer and a writer...
  • And if you want to help millions of people improve their photography...

Then this page could literally change your life…

But only if you keep reading.

iPhonePhotographySchool.com is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. This website is visited by 1,121,104 readers each month, and we’re looking to grow it even further.

Publishing excellent photography tutorials for free is an essential part of our strategy. This is why we’re looking for expert iPhone photographers who want to share their knowledge with the world.

This is a long-term freelance position, and you can work from anywhere in the world.

5 Reasons To Become A Photography Writer For iPhone Photography School

1. Combine Your Passion For Photography And Writing

You love photography. You love writing. It's not always easy to find a way to combine your two passions, but it doesn't have to be the case.

Great photography and excellent writing is exactly what we're looking for.

Join us, and spend time doing what you truly love - writing about photography.

2. Get High-Profile Exposure As A Photographer

You already know this: to get recognition as a photographer, talent alone is not enough anymore. People have to have a way to discover you.

With 1,121,104 monthly readers, we're among the most established photography websites in the world. So when you'll get published on our site, unexpected opportunities will start flowing your way.

Our authors have gone on to become full-time photography teachers and participate in once in a lifetime photography projects - all thanks to getting discovered on our site.

3. Help Millions Of People Improve Their Photography

Helping others is one of the most rewarding things you can do in life. While this is something that everyone should practice in their daily life, you can also do it while earning a living.

Think about everything you've discovered as a photographer, and you'll realise how much you have to give back to others.

Write for us, and your work will directly benefit millions of people. You’ll not only inspire your readers to take beautiful photos, but also to preserve their most cherished memories!

4. Fast-Track Your Growth As A Writer

As a passionate writer, you'd love to get even better at your craft.

We get how important growth is for our writers. That's why your every article will receive a personalized video feedback from one of our world-class editors. They'll share every tip and trick they have to help you get better.

Write for us, and you'll improve your writing faster than ever before.

5. Get Industry-Leading Compensation

We value your work and unique knowledge as an expert iPhone photographer and writer, so we want to compensate your work fairly.

You'll receive ¢10 for every word and $2 for every image that goes in the final article. The more useful quality content you provide, the more you get paid.

Not only that, this is an industry-leading payment scheme. Think of it this way - you'll typically get to pocket between $200 and $400 for doing a job you love anyway.

Here’s What We Expect From You…

  • You’re an excellent photographer with a vast iPhone photography portfolio
  • You can explain complex technical and photography concepts in simple terms
  • You’re a native English speaker with a passion for writing
  • You can produce polished articles that don't need much editing
  • You have an excellent attention to detail
Please only apply if you meet all these criteria. Other applications will not be considered.

Click Here To Apply

If you delay submitting your application, someone else will be hired before you.

Job Description

** APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS: To be considered, kindly apply through our website. Please visit https://www.prosemedia.com/writer/register to submit your application. **

==

Prose Media (https://www.prosemedia.com/write) is a content marketing startup that crafts high-quality written content — from blog posts and articles to web copy and social media posts — for a wide range of tech brands, primarily B2B.

We’re currently looking for talented technology writers and journalists to join our network as independent contractors (i.e., freelancers) for individual paid projects.

Our tech clients run the gamut in terms of size and focus. On the application form, you'll have the opportunity to specify your own topic specialties -- e.g., B2B / enterprise tech; B2C; cloud computing; big data; electronics / hardware; mobile; telecom; gaming; e-commerce; healthcare tech; ad tech; clean tech; and productivity / BPM.

We’re a small private agency, not an online freelance marketplace, so there’s no need for you to “bid” on gigs. Instead, writers who've been accepted to our network are contacted whenever we feel they’re right for a project. Payment is made on a per-project basis. Rates vary based on the type and length of the assignment.

(Kindly note: As a nascent service looking to build a diverse talent base, we have more writers than we do available work, but we will regularly keep you in mind for suitable projects.)

Writing samples are especially important. Feel free to submit any work that you’re proud of — whether it’s a batch of social media posts, a blog post or article, an outstanding essay or paper, or any other written work that demonstrates your skill.

On the application, you can express interest in one or more industries. You can also indicate the content types you believe you're best suited to write (e.g., social media posts, blog posts, listicles, etc.).

items.title: MeetEdgar: Digital Content Manager
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

You are a masterful writer who loves to write and is inspired by a good deadline! This is a fast-paced, high-production job and you must have previous experience in that kind of environment. You're comfortable with direct feedback and can make rapid changes when needed.

Your style is conversational and compelling. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, and we like our audience to have fun with the content that we create. You despise spammy, “content farm” style writing. You create engaging, smart writing that will stand out from the endless stream of mediocre blog posts and sales emails.

You have a results-oriented mindset. You're guided by data and you're interested in writing that produces measurable results. You enjoy circling back through what you've created to gauge its effectiveness, and you geek out on making changes or performing tests to optimize those results. You can view your work objectively to recognize what is and isn't working, then course correct as needed.

You know our audience intimately - in fact, you love reading the same type of content they do. You get excited about topics like social media management, online marketing (especially for small businesses), and business productivity. You know how to turn a piece about a Facebook algorithm change into something that's actually entertaining and compelling to read, without sacrificing usefulness for style. You love a great tech tool and you're always on the hunt for what's new and interesting in our industry.

Job Perks: Work from home (or wherever there’s strong wifi)Check ‘em out in even more detail here (you know you’re curious): http://ed.gr/MeetEdgarBenefits

items.content:
The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Company: Course Concierge LLC

10 July 2018

The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Hi there,

My name’s Edward. I work with entrepreneur and speaker Till H. Gross, and together we run Course Concierge. We’re an online course publishing house that develops courses for NYT best-selling authors, TED speakers, social media authorities and those with something to say.

Our clients include YouTubers with 150,000,000 views, one of the most hotly-followed health experts on Instagram, and a coach to NFL athletes, NBA players and U.S. special forces.

Check us out here: http://courseconcierge.com

For the right person, this is a Dream Opportunity — and dream company.

We’re a year-and-a-half-old and growing, and looking for someone for a role that fuses Creative Director and Editor-in-Chief; someone who can oversee and orchestrate our productions – design, development, marketing, editorial and film.

Online courses, for the most part, have a lethargic reputation. Compared with today’s video games, things are still in the primitive stages; about as far evolved as Pong. But online courses’ possibilities are endless, and that’s something we’ve set to override. A book is a book. An online course is, well, anything you want it to be. There’s a promise of the internet that’s yet to be delivered, and we’d like to be its bearer.

Each production is a serious operation, and we have many going on at the same time. There’s a picture of U.S. chess champion Bobby Fischer at age 21 playing 50 games of chess simultaneously. We need someone who can match that in productions, on topics as varied as autism enterprises to cybersecurity to yoga, and each with its own multiple five-figure budget. You’d be overseeing productions at large, tasked with driving them forward with the team harmoniously.

Directing has a great reverence in film-making. We’d like someone who can help bring about the same in online education.

We’re a company that has our house in order, and we’ve structured things very deliberately. We have a system.

And our early works have been supremely effective – we know how to drive action. The below is just one week following the release of “The Weekend Woodworker”, a course we helped produce with Steve Ramsey:

https://www.instagram.com/p/BbKigoaH1VU/?taken-by=steveramsey_wwmm

One heuristic for a course for strength coaches: “I’d happily have this person train my mum & dad after taking this”. Another all-purpose: “Would I be comfortable selling this to my best friend?” (We need courses for which the answer is a resounding Yes!)

You need to have a definite interest in online learning, curriculum development and the future of education – and relish the prospect of crafting the best learning experience imaginable.

Our ideal candidate...

- Is a strong leader. You can put pressure on the team to produce courses on time and know what a great product looks like.

- Considers themselves a coach. We want someone who can get the very best out of everyone on the team – a nurturer.

- Has a philosophy of learning. Our clients often want workbooks and quizzes. But how to do them in non-boring way? We want someone for whom, pent up from all the things you think wrong with the school educational system, wants to put things right with free rein to rewrite the rules. The opportunity to shake things up excites you.

- Can be both a “maker” (rolling up your sleeves to do things) and a manager – able to switch between the two effortlessly.

- Can guide smooth handoffs between team members, and push responsibility widely throughout the team while keeping a close eye to things.

- Can hold their own with some seriously accomplished clientele. You’re ultimately culpable for the success and client experience of productions, and a client should be able to get you on the phone promptly (in the rare circumstance) they’re dissatisfied with something.

- Is willing and able to recruit other course editors, continuing to build our brilliant team as we grow.

- Is interested on all things on the horizon – AR, VR and other cutting-edge technologies and how we might utilise them.

- Can work with clients to ensure they get what they want, yet knows how to say “no” when necessary.

We’re a great company to join. Here’s why…

- The company is still young (just 18 months) and you will be getting in at the ground level. This will be one of our most important positions, and crucial to making sure our next steps are the right ones.

- Despite the company being young, we’ve a combined experience of several decades in publishing and online course creation. We have an unbelievably engaged team, with world-class people in every department, from video production to design to development to copywriting and editorial.

- We’ve got our ducks in a row. We have solid processes across the company (most strongly in production) and battle-proven workflows. The foundation is already there, so it’s yours to focus on building what we have.

- Our clients are fantastic. We have the good fortune to be incredibly selective in who we work with, and a great many have a great sense of mission in what they do.

- We’re a remote company and you’ve the freedom to work from anywhere. Preferably we’re looking for someone in North America, but are open to candidates the world over. (Our current team spans 13 time zones.)

- We’re going places.

*

This isn’t to be a typical job search. We expect to spend up to six months looking to find the right person.

There’s no deadline to reply, but please get in touch if you think you could be a good fit.

Pay will be set at a competitive rate, and we’re happy to work with notice periods, transitioning to having you come on full-time when ready.

Please do not send a CV – we don’t care where, or even whether, you went to school –  but do note experience that would allow you to command the position.

For those who stand out, we will be in touch to discuss next steps.

Thank you for considering the position. I look forward to hearing from you,

Edward
How to apply:
There’s no deadline to reply, but please get in touch if you think you could be a good fit: Director@CourseConcierge.com. Please do not send a CV – we don’t care where, or even whether, you went to school – but do note experience that would allow you to command the position.

items.title: Article/Content Writer for In-house WRITING BOOTCAMP
items.content:
Article/Content Writer for In-house WRITING BOOTCAMP

Company: Undisclosed
Location: Anywhere | Remote

Job Type: Freelance

Description

If you are committed to leveling up your writing (and in effect, your career), then READ ON.

This is an opportunity for someone who has the basics of writing down, but is looking to get PAID to turn their writing into something that really shines.

We will GUARANTEE that if you are willing to put the effort in and really COMMIT, your writing will become the best it's ever been.

It will take HARD WORK. But this job is about being paid to get training and use these skills not only for this role, but in all other future roles. This job is a TURNING POINT... A Game Changer!

We have trained over 30+ writers. Some have stayed. Some of moved on to greener pastures. But all of them have said they have learned more working with our team than any writing course in school or at university.

==== READ BELOW FOR JOB DESCRIPTION ====

This is a GHOSTWRITING ROLE. You will not be credited for your work.

We are in search of native English-speaking writers who are flexible and able to adapt their voice/tone/style of writing into persuasive, upbeat, blog and ad copywriting.

You must have *true COMMAND* of the English language with the ability to take a dry "boring" subject (academic, fact-based) and make it interesting (blogging tone).

TOPIC(S):
- Luxury Pens (Fountain Pens, Rollerball, Ballpoint)
- Tarot Cards (Spirituality, New Age, etc.)

YOUR EXPERIENCE:
- Copywriting
- Blogging
- Article Writing
- Online research (forums, blogs, company websites, wikipedia, etc.)
- Editing (self-editing and editing others work)

Must be willing to undergo ONGOING TRAINING via web conference calls and tutorials (book training).

TRAINING INCLUDES:
2 - 3 hours a day of uninterrupted writing.
Also heavy blog reading, researching, writing, editing other writers' work, rewriting, and on-going online training and webinars. You'll have one-on-one sessions with members of our staff to help pinpoint problem areas and improve your writing

Once hired, we ask that writers submit work in two (2) phases:
(Phase 1) Outlines with SEO optimized keyword researched terms - flat rate ($15, $20, or $25)
(Phase 2) Articles - paid by the word - minimum article word count of 1500-2000 words (Rate - word count x $0.015) Ex: 2000 words = $30

This is a great gig because you will be paid both for the outline and also for the finished article.

THIS IS NOT FOR THE FAINT OF HEART.
This gig is for someone who is committed to improving his/her writing. If you know you're hitting a wall with your writing and you're looking to work with true masters of the craft, then reply to this post and we'll get you started on training.

NOTE: We DO NOT accept all applicants. Each step of the process is an evaluation. We can choose to end the engagement at any time. At the same time, you can walk away at any moment, if you feel this is not a right fit. This is not for everyone. We need you to be aware of this before moving forward.

NOTE: This is a full-time commitment. If you have full-time gig, consider this like 2nd full-time job, as you will be reading, studying, writing, editing, and rewriting. So please be aware of the commitment level necessary to succeed. Consider this a WRITING BOOTCAMP.

=== HOW TO APPLY ===

Please apply via the link in the ad.

We look forward to your reply and application.

items.content:
Amplify Life is a personal challenge and coaching hub, recently available on the App Store and Google Play.
We are looking for a creative Copywriter to join our dynamic team based in a unique location on the outskirts of Horsham. With stunning countryside views, a team who are full of life and a quickly evolving brand, Amplify Life is truly an exceptional place to work.

Reporting into the CMO, you will write clear, concise and compelling copy for various mediums (such as app and web copy, ads, blog posts and newsletters) to support health and fitness coaching content. You will conduct thorough research and interviews and work with creative professionals to build marketing projects and campaigns. Your words will inform and engage our target audiences.

Our ideal candidate is a team-spirited, skilled and imaginative writer with an eye for detail. If you can grasp project requirements quickly and offer valuable insight, we’d like to meet you.

Responsibilities include:
• Writing clear, attractive copy with a distinct voice
• Working closely with UX lead to define copy for the App and the website
• Interpreting copywriting briefs to understand project requirements
• Collaborating with designers, PR and other professionals on large- and small-scale marketing projects (e.g. email campaigns and landing pages)
• Supporting our Social Media campaigns
• Conducting high-quality research and interviews
• Editing and proofreading copy as needed
• Using SEO and ASO principles to maximize copy’s reach
• Sourcing images and other content
• Supporting sponsored features copy
What we are looking for:
• Proven experience as a copywriter or related role
• Knowledge of online content strategy and creation
• Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills
• Experience with ASO and SEO
• Strong research skills
• Creativity
• Collaborative spirit
• Excellent time-management and organizational skills
• BSc/BA in marketing, English, journalism or related field
• Familiar with Sport/Fitness/Health industry

Does this sound like you? Then please get in touch with your CV and up to three writing samples so we can get an idea of your best work. Feel free to include links to your content or portfolio in your application.

Amplify can offer a competitive salary and benefits as well as 25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays). Our offices offer a stunning and peaceful setting to work in, a fully stocked soft drinks fridge, BBQ facilities, sun terrace, table tennis table, football and badminton facilities and a woodland adventure trail.

Due to remote location access to a car is a must!

items.content:
Freelance Writer

Company: Well Authored
Location: New York

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Calling all content writers!

WellAuthored.com is seeking versatile, experienced writers to contribute at least eight articles every week, each between 600 and 1,200 words. Stories are assigned by editors and cover a wide range of topics for a variety of clients and businesses. Each article must include between one and four embedded links (provided to you by the editors) that are SEO-driven for the clients. There are no interviews or sourcing required for the pieces, but some light research will be necessary to ensure a conversational-but-expert voice. Rates vary depending on story length, number of embeds and writing experience, but start at $15 per 600-word story and go up from there. Pay is distributed to writers weekly and on a per-article basis.

Editors will walk you through the entire process and provide feedback on all pieces. This is a great opportunity for consistent, remote freelance work with weekly payouts!

Selected candidates will be given paid test article assignments (up to six), each of which will be due within 24 hours. Once a writer passes the trial period, he or she will be contracted for at least eight articles each week.

For more information and to apply, send your cover letter, resume, and links to website and/or three recently published clips to [email protected]

Application Instructions

Send your cover letter, resume, and links to website and/or three recently published clips.

items.content:
Part-Time Content Writer

Company: Kayak Advisors
Location: Remote/Online

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Job Title: Part-Time Content Writer

Location: Remote/Online

Kayak Advisors (https://kayakadvisors.com) is seeking a regular writer with experience writing about kayaking and/or kayak fishing. The website provides reviews and vital advice regarding kayaking to readers, and we’re seeking a team member to create content that will suit the needs of a captive and knowledgeable audience.

As a writer, you will receive regular content assignments from the manager and editor, and you will be expected to complete the assignment within the guidelines given. Article topics can vary but may include product reviews, advice posts, “best of” posts, feature articles, and guest posts on various topics. Other projects may be requested as the working relationship grows. Further revisions may be requested after work is submitted for review.

Requirements

  • Native English speaker.
  • The ability to write at least two articles per week. These articles usually are about 1000-2000 words each, but on occasion may require more. More articles may be requested (but would not be mandatory) over time.
  • The ability to implement editor feedback into future writing.
  • Experience writing for online venues and websites.
  • Experience with Kayaking and/or aquatic sports. This includes basic product knowledge, safety procedures, and standard practices.
  • Familiarity with AP style.
  • Can complete standard article requests within three days’ time.
  • Strong research skills.
  • Can take SEO concerns into consideration when writing content.
  • Can keep a consistent line of communication open with managers and editors.
  • Familiarity with Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Microsoft Word.

Additional Preferences

  • A degree in English or closely related field.
  • Previous experience writing with WordPress.
  • Knowledge of how to tailor content so that it can maintain a strong social media presence.

What We Provide

  • Compensation will be .05-.07 cents per word, with potential changes made for non-standard projects.
  • Tools and training necessary for the success of your writing and content for Kayak Advisors

Please Do the Following When Submitting Your Application:

  • In your application please put the word “aquatic” at the top. Applications that do not follow this step will be disregarded.
  • Please include three samples of your work. If possible, send samples as closely as closely related as possible to the content that Kayak Advisors publishes.

Answer the following questions:

  1. What types of writing have you done in the past?
  2. What skill sets do you have that make you think you would be a perfect fit for Kayak Advisors?
  3. What is your experience with kayaking and aquatic sports?
  4. What is your experience writing about these topics?
  5. What is your availability to work?
  6. What separates your writing from the rest?
  7. Is there anything else you’d like us to know about you?

Submit any other information or documents that you think will be helpful in reviewing your application.

Send your application to [email protected]

Note:

We will own the exclusive rights to any content, it must not be shared, published or appear anywhere else either in print or online without our expressed permission.

Application Instructions

Send your application to [email protected]

Freelance writer rate + site credits + various perks
Minimum 3-month commitment & min. 1 feature per month

Location: Anywhere in the known universe with an internet connection OR from our offices in LA, Mexico City, or York, UK

Who we are: Always now, forever independent

Film Daily is an online platform connecting audiences with indie filmmakers via news, views, and reviews.

Our publication is growing quickly and we’re looking for a team of talented freelance scribes to write about the ever-expanding world of indie film, filmmaking, film festivals, and content streaming.

Our target audience is Gen Z, Gen X, and Millennials. We aim to keep our audience entertained about entertainment.

We foster a culture of communication, community, teamwork, and collaboration. Join us now!
Person specification

We need streaming savvy content writers to join our team. You’ll love indie film and peak/cinematic TV and keep up to date with entertainment news. You’ll be able to write quickly, accurately and legally and know how to pitch an editor.

• Film & TV obsessive
• You know your Kurosawa from your Kubrick, your Lynch from your Leigh, your Girls from your Broad City.
• High achiever
• You (think you) understand the way the film & TV industries works.
• You know how to use web searches to learn new skills.
• Dedicated lifelong learner
• Looking for a new challenge
• Willing to do whatever it takes to achieve results
• Able to prioritize your workload
• You think change in Hollywood is long overdue.
• Impressive portfolio of published articles
• Desire to work as a journalist or editor
• Understanding of the way online publications work
• Tenacious
• You know A LOT about film and TV.
• Words are just about your favorite thing.
• You live on the internet.
• You can take a complicated story and cut it down to 280 characters.
What we can offer

• Must have some social media and Wordpress experience

• Self-editing

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Be part of the writer’s community who are helping travelers and hotels around the world

Company: Arrivedo
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

We want to change the way everyone travels. We want travelers to experience the best local insights every time and make the most out of their trip. This is your chance to help us change that.

Arrivedo works with a community of more than 1600 international freelance writers, (including, but not limited to) travel-oriented bloggers, authors, literature and creative writing students who create Neighborhood Guides for hotels all over the world. We currently host over 650 Neighborhood Guides for hotels in more than 120 cities around the globe, providing our services to renowned international chains like JW Marriott, Waldorf-Astoria, Four Seasons, Westin Hotels & Resorts, Ritz-Carlton, as well as B&Bs, hostels and boutique hotels in remote locations around the globe.

What does the Arrivedo Writers Community do?
Help travelers with local recommendations you share in a hotel’s Neighborhood Guides.


How do THEY do it?
1st: Outreach to hotels: Approach hotels via email or in person offering to set up their writer’s profile in Arrivedo. (We provide support, resources, and incentives to help you)

2nd: Gather hotels local recommendations: Interview hotel staff to collect the hotel’s local recommendations and insights into their neighborhood.
3th: Create a Neighborhood Guide: Use Arrivedo’s editor to create 8-10 short articles showcasing the hotel’s local recommendations from themes ranging from routes, gastronomy, nightlife, cultural activities, essential tips and more. Here is an example Neighborhood Guide from Hotel Majestic in Chicago: https://arrivedo.com/dest/en/chicago/hotel/the-majestic-hotel-3.

 

Why do THEY do it?
With Arrivedo you have the chance to go beyond and help travelers to experience the world in a different way with your written word. You have the opportunity to share and learn about other cultures. The unique community of Arrivedo Writers helps you with the best tips on how to communicate your ideas, outreach and even get to know others around the globe.

 

What are the benefits?

  • Getting certified as one of Arrivedo’s 1600 international travel writers.
  • Be part of our private network of Arrivedo Writers.
  • Being able to sell your writing services to any hotel in the world. Arrivedo does not take a commission from your deals with hotels. Transactions are 1-on-1 in between writers and hotels.
  • Improve your Sales skills. We assign you a coach to help you on the outreaching process and provide you with all needed material.
  • Be aware that hotels prefer to pay with free accommodation (normally 3 nights), but you can negotiate a monetary payment.
